Sobre Talca existe una curiosa referencia en Chile, la frase "Talca, París, y Londres". Entre los mitos al respecto, algunos dicen que es una derivación de la originalmente dicha por un inglés "Talca parece Londres", por la abundante neblina que cubre frecuentemente la ciudad en la temporada invernal, a semejanza de la capital del Reino Unido.
texts.en:
This communal bank is called "Anhelo." It's made up of 21 entrepreneurs who make a living doing business, specifically selling jewelry made of steel, technological accessories, toys, embroidery, women's clothing, women's lingerie, and chocolates, and working weekly and having a store and a hair salon, among offering other services. All of them belong to the city of Talca.

Francisca, the communal bank group's treasurer who is standing in the back row fourth from the right in the picture, is in front of the window and has long, light brown hair that's down. She's been making a living in the imitation jewelry business (making handmade necklaces and bracelets) for five years and selling young women's clothing for three years. She says that she works from Monday to Friday and her schedule is spread out according to her availability.

She buys the merchandise that she is going to need at a lower cost in the city of Santiago in shops and at wholesalers that specialize in selling imitation jewelry accessories and at clothing stores or street markets, therefore being financially convenient.

With this loan she will buy accessories for necklaces and young women's clothing of different sizes and styles.

The goal of her business is to settle into a store in order to generate greater earnings and thus opt for a better quality of life.

Francisca lives with her mother, grandmother, sister, and young 4-year-old son. Her dream at a personal level is to be able to complete her university studies, and at a working level, to continue with the business in order to provide the best for her son and family.

She is very happy and grateful for this opportunity given by Fondo Esperanza since it will allow her to invest in her business. She says that the trainings have been fundamental for her business and also for her own personal development since she's learned to organize and distribute her earnings and investments in a better way. With respect to the communal bank's group of which she's a part, she says that there's very good communication. Talca belongs to the region of Maule, located in the central area of the country. It represents the administrative, financial, and cultural center of the region being the most important city in the Chilean Central Valley.

There is a curious reference in Chile about Talca- the phrase, "Talca, Paris, and London." Among myths on the subject some say that it's a derivation from that originally said by an Englishman, "Talca looks like London," due to the abundant mist that frequently covers the city in the winter season, resembling the capital of the United Kingdom.

loans.use: to buy accessories for necklaces and young women's clothing of different sizes and styles.

loans.name: Mary Ann

texts.en: Mary Ann has aimed to strengthen her small variety store business to earn sufficient income for her family. She is 26 years old and has one infant-age child. She is a single parent because her boyfriend abandoned her after learning she is pregnant. Despite this, she accepted her responsibility to support her child with the help of her parents. While she takes care of her baby, she finds time to manage her small variety store. She wants to increase her product offerings to satisfy her customers' demands, but due to insufficient capital she needs an additional of PHP 20,000 to buy soft drinks, candies, breads, powder soaps, beverages and seasonings to sell. She believes that her loan will make it possible for her to improve the business.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, candies, breads, powder soaps, beverages and seasonings to sell.

location.town: Brgy. Balzain, Dupax del Sur, Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Basem

texts.en:
Basem is from Iraq. He is 37 years old, married and has five children. He is the only provider for the family.

Basem owns a shop for menswear. He established his business in 1997 and now he has one employee. He has good experience in this field and a good reputation in his local community.

He is requesting $3000 as loan to pay the annual rent for the shop. He is aiming to grow his business and increase his profits so he will be able to provide his family better living conditions.

loans.use: to pay the annual rent for his menswear shop

loans.name: Roland

texts.fr: Roland est un homme de 46 ans marié père de 5 enfants dont l'age varie entre 5 et 22 ans,  trois de ses enfants vont encore à l'école. Elle aussi une personne à sa charge. Il est commerçant et a ouvert une mercerie qu'il gère depuis 10 ans. son activité fonctionne bien sa clientèle s'agrandit au fil du temps d'où l'importance de ce crédit qui lui donnera l'opportunité d'agrandir son activité en augmentant le stock de ses marchandises à savoir acheter les tissus pagnes gros et les bobines de fils ainsi que le petit matériel nécessaire pour la coutures. il réinvestira une partie des bénéfices que lui apportera ce crédit dans son activité le reste sera économisé pour la scolarité de ses enfants.
texts.en: Roland is a 46-year-old man who is the father of five children, from 5 to 22 years old, of whom three are still in school. He also has one other person to support. He is a merchant and has opened a sewing supplies store that he has been running for ten years. His business is doing well. His customer base is growing over the course of time, thus the importance of this loan, which will give him the opportunity to expand his business by increasing his stock of merchandise, namely 'pagnes' (the colorful cloth of western Africa) in bulk and spools of thread, as well as sundry supplies for making clothing. He will reinvest part of his profits into his business. The rest will be saved for his children's education.

loans.use: to buy 'pagne' cloth in bulk and spools of thread

loans.name: Trinidad

texts.es:
Trinidad tiene 52 años, está casada con Donato, con quien tiene dos hijos, pero ahora sólo vive con uno de ellos, en la casa que compraron hace 37 años.
Sus padres se dedicaban a la artesanía y desde muy pequeña ella aprendió a trabajar con los telares, combinar los colores y las técnicas de bordado. “Mi papá ganaba concursos de artesanía, era uno de los mejores”, comenta. Cuando formó su familia se dedicaba a la agricultura, con esas ganancias compró los tres telares que ahora posee, con ellos realiza frazadas, vestuarios para los cantantes folklóricos y otras prendas. Los principales días de venta es durante la festividad en honor a los animales y los carnavales. En esas fechas los pedidos de sus clientes llegan todo el día, por lo que tiene que duplicar sus esfuerzos para obtener buenas ganancias. Ahora desea abrir una juguería en su casa para tener un ingreso extra.

Ella pertenece al grupo solidario “Santiago de Chauca” y este es su tercer crédito con MFP. En todo este tiempo logró obtener grandes beneficios, mejorando su negocio y aprendiendo de los integrantes de su grupo, a quienes quiere como hermanos. Por esa razón promete ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas.
Trinidad invertirá este dinero en la compra de madejas de lana sintética, hilo de colores y varios kilos de algodón para realizar los pedidos que tiene por la temporada festiva.
texts.en:
Trinidad is 52 years old, and is married to Donato. They have two children, one of whom lives with them in the home that they purchased 37 years ago.

Trinidad's parents were artisans, and from a very young age she learned to work with looms, combine colors and weave intricate designs and borders in fabric. "My father would win craft contests; he was one of the best," she says. When Trinidad started her own family, she was working as a farmer. With her income from farming, she bought three looms that she still uses, and began weaving blankets, as well as costumes for folk singers and other events. Her biggest sale days of the year come during the time of the festival to honor the animals and carnivals. During this period of time, Trinidad is constantly taking orders from clients for woven items, and she has to double her efforts to keep up with demand. 

Presently, she wants to open up a juice bar to generate additional income. She is a member of the solidarity group, "Santiago de Chauca," and this is her third loan with MFP. Over the past years she has benefited greatly from loans, as they have helped her to improve her business and learn from her fellow group members, who are like brothers and sisters to her. She promises to continue her history of prompt loan payments. Trinidad plans to use the support from this loan to purchase skeins of synthetic wool, colored threads and several kilograms of cotton for completing client orders for the festival season.

loans.use: to purchase skeins of synthetic wool, colored threads and several kilograms of cotton to complete client orders for the festival season.

loans.name: Alecsander

texts.es:
Alecsander tiene 49 años, está casado con Blanca, con quien tiene dos hijos, quienes ya son independientes.
Junto a su esposa comparten el trabajo; ella se levanta muy temprano para atender su tienda de comestibles, mientras él recoge los litros de leche de los ganaderos de la zona. Usan l aleche para la elaboración de quesos. A la semana elaboran un promedio de 490 quesos que trasladan a los comerciantes mayoristas en la capital del país. Le gusta mucho su trabajo, pues gracias a eso pudo obtener su auto y unas motos que le ayudan en trasladarse a la ciudad, pues su pueblo queda a dos horas. Ahora desea incrementar su producción e industrializar el proceso, porque por el momento la elaboración es artesanal.

Este es su primer crédito con MFP, por lo que promete seguir con los pagos de manera puntual. Le gusta mucho trabajar con su grupo, ya que le enseñan a administrar su dinero.
Alecsander invertirá el dinero de este préstamo en la compra de varios litros de leche para abastecerse y seguir con su producción de quesos. Al día compra un promedio de 400 litros.
texts.en:
Alecsander, age 49, is married to Blanca.  They have two children, who are now independent.

He and his wife share the work.  She gets up very early in order to tend to their food store.  Meanwhile, he picks up liters of milk from the cattle farmers in the area.  They use the milk to make cheeses.  They make an average of 490 cheeses a week.  They transport the cheeses to the wholesale merchants in the capital of the country.

He likes his work a lot.  Thanks to this he was able to get his car and some motorcycles, which help in transporting the milk to the city.  His town is two hours from the city.  He now wishes to increase his production and industrialize the process.  At this time the cheese is made by hand.

This is his first loan with MFP.  He pledges to continue making his payments punctually.  He really likes working with his group because they teach him how to manage his money.

loans.use: to buy various liters of milk in order to continue producing more cheeses.

loans.name: Voeurn

texts.en: Voeurn is originally from a village of the Kror Kor District, Pursat Province of Cambodia. She is a 32-year-old married mother of two children, one daughter and one son, both of whom are dependent on her as they are too young to attend school. She has struggled to make a living through farming rice on five hectares of farmland for several years. Besides helping her grow paddy rice, her husband also works as motorcycle repairer locally to earn additional income. Together, they can earn approximately KHR 20,000 per day to meet the family’s needs. However, low crop yield is still the main challenge for her business. This is the first microloan for Voeurn with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. She is applying for a loan of KHR 2,500,000 to buy fertilizer for her farmland and will use a portion of it to pay for labor costs in transplanting rice. She hopes to earn more income from the current business so as to improve her living condition and set aside some money for her children’s education when they reach the age for schooling.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for her farmland.

loans.name: Sule Mogga

texts.en:
Sule  is a 30-year-old  businesswoman  who lives in Juba. She is married and has three children between the ages of 3  and 10. All of them go to school.

Sule  runs a general store and has been in business for three years. She has no  employees. She heard about Finance Sudan through  other clients. She is taking a loan of  2000 sdg to purchase soap, sugar  and many other items.  In addition to this business, she has no other source of income.

In five years, Sule  would like to expand her  business and open a big shop. Her  major challenges include high  transportation costs. Sule  says she is happy about the loans given by Finance Sudan  through Kiva.

loans.use: to buy items like sugar, soap, eggs, etc.

loans.name: Léocadie

texts.fr: Léocadie est une  femme de 41 ans mariée, mère d'un enfant âgé de 16 ans.  elle ouvert une parfumerie mélangée d'un petit secrétariat qu'elle gère depuis six ans déjà. Elle a souvent un problème du a l'absence de produits cosmétiques, mèches, et greffes dans sa structure, ce qui pousse sa clientèle vers la concurrence ceci étant du à la petitesse de son capital parce qu'elle achète ses produits en détail. Son but étant de satisfaire sa clientèle et de réaliser un grand bénéfice. Elle sollicite un crédit pour pouvoir acheter son matériel en grande quantité celui qui permettra d'atteindre ses objectifs. Le bénéfice tiré de ce crédit l'aidera a satisfaire ses besoins, ceux de son enfant, aussi d'épargner pour accroitre son activité dans le future.
texts.en:
Léocadie is a 41-year-old married woman who is the mother of a 16-year-old child. She opened a perfume shop/office which she has been running for six years already. She often has a problem with a lack of cosmetic products, hair extensions, and weaves in her shop. This drives her customers to the competition due to her meager capital, since she makes her purchases at the retail level. 

Her goal being to satisfy her customers and to make a bigger profit, she is requesting a loan to buy her supplies in bulk. This will enable her to reach her goals. The profits derived from this loan will help her to satisfy her needs and those of her child, as well as to save money for growing her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy boxes of hair extension, weaves, and cosmetic products

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a water tank

loans.name: Florci

texts.es:
Florci tiene 45 años, está casada con Cesarlo, con quien tiene nueve hijos, de los cuales ahora sólo viven con cinco, en la casa que compraron hace 38 años.
Se dedica a la venta de bebidas durante las festividades del pueblo, le va muy bien, pero ella desea incrementar sus ganancias y dedicarse, durante la semana, a una actividad estable. Por esa razón, hace cuatro meses, comenzó con la compra y venta de ovejas. Adquiere entre cinco y ocho ovejas, luego las vende en la feria ganadera de la ciudad. En este tiempo logró obtener buenas ganancias, como también experiencia, “cuando el precio de venta baja, guardo los animales, los alimento más y la próxima semana vendo a un precio mayor”, menciona. Ahora desea empezar a vender, pero todavía no cuenta con el capital suficiente.

Él pertenece al grupo solidario “Santiago de Chauca” y este es su crédito número 12 con MFP. En todo este tiempo logró obtener grandes beneficios, mejorando su negocio y aprendiendo de los integrantes de su grupo, a quienes quiere como hermanos. Por esa razón promete ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas.
Florci invertirá el dinero de este préstamo en la compra de más ovejas.
texts.en:
Florci is 45 years old, married to Cesarlo whom she has 9 children with;  five of her children still live with her in their home they purchased 38 years ago.
She sells refreshments during the town´s festivities and she does well but she would like to increase her earnings and do something during the week that is more stable.  For this reason, four months ago, she started buying and selling sheep.  She will purchase between 5 and 8 sheep and later sell them at the town´s livestock fair.  She's earned well and gained good experience during this time.  She states, " when the prices are low, I keep the animals, give them more feed and sell them at a higher price the following week.".  She would like to start selling again but does not have enough capital to do so.

She is part of the group, " Santiago de Chauca", and this is her 12th loan with MFP.  Throughout this time she's obtained great benefits, she's improved her business, and has learned from other members of the group whom she loves like brothers.  She promises to be prompt with her payments.  
Florci would invest her loan towards the purchase of more sheep.

loans.use: to purchase more sheep

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es:
Margarita tiene 36 años, está casada con José, con quien tiene dos hijos: Claudio y Mayela. Viven en la casa que compró hace 8 años.
Hace poco cerró el locutorio donde brindaba el servicio de llamadas telefónicas, por motivo de falta de capital. Con el tiempo logró ahorrar una suma considerable de dinero, gracias a su esposo que trabaja en una empresa de autos como mecánico; con ello compraron dos autos que alquilan para el trasporte público (taxi). Diario le pagan 30 nuevos soles por el servicio. Este negocio le ayuda mucho en los gastos de su hogar, sobre todo porque no necesita mucho mantenimiento, pues su esposo se encarga de eso, cambiando el aceite y revisando constantemente el auto. “Gracias a su buen mantenimiento pueden trabajar sin problemas en el trasporte público”, comenta. Ahora espera juntar el dinero necesario para volver a abrir su primer negocio, donde está segura, tendrá mucho éxito. 

Ella pertenece al banco comunal “IDME” y este su crédito número 26 con MFP. En todos estos años pudo mejorar su negocio, pues aprovechó el dinero con mucha inteligencia. Por otro lado, promete, una vez más, cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas. Y además le agrada ser parte de su grupo.
Margarita invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de baldes de aceite para el mantenimiento de los autos.
texts.en:
Margarita is 36 years old and is married to José. They have two children together, Claudio and Mayela. They live in the home she bought eight years ago. 

The shop where she used to offer telephone services closed recently, due to a lack of capital. In time she managed to save up a considerable amount of money, thanks to her husband, who works for an auto company as a mechanic. They used it to purchase two cars, which they rent out as public transporation (taxi). She gets paid 30 nuevos soles per day for this service. 

This business helps her a lot with home expenses, mainly because it doesn't require much maintenance, since her husband takes care of oil changes and constantly checks the car. "Good maintenance allows them to be used as public transportation without any problems," she says. Now she hopes to save up enough money to reopen her first business, and she is sure she will be very successful.

She belongs to the communal bank IDME, and this is her 26th loan with MFP. Over all these years, she was able to improve her business, by being smart about the money and making the most of it. On the other hand, she once again promises to make her installment payments. She also enjoys being a part of her group.

Margarita will invest the money she has requested in the purchase of motor oil for the maintenance of her cars.

loans.use: to purchase motor oil for the maintenance of her cars.

loans.name: Antonio

texts.es:
Antonio tiene 47 años, está casado con Elva, con quien tiene cinco hijos, de los cuales ahora sólo vive con cuatro de ellos. La casa donde viven desde hace 3 años es de su tía. 
“Mi hijo estudiará una carrera profesional, por ello deseo incrementar mis ingresos y así brindarle una mejor calidad de vida”, afirma. Su principal ingreso económico se centraba en la agricultura, pero hace 4 años, gracias a MFP adquirió un motocarro, con el cual trabaja todos los días trasportando a las personas de su localidad. “Cuando comencé no tenía mucha competencia, con el tiempo aumentaron los motocarros, pero aún así sigo teniendo ingresos”, comenta. Ahora desea mejorar su movilidad, pues necesita un mantenimiento general.

Él pertenece al grupo solidario “Santiago de Chauca” y este es su segundo crédito con MFP y se compromete a ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas.
Antonio invertirá el dinero de este préstamo en la compra de un motor nuevo para su motocarro y si el dinero le alcanza, adquirirá 10 sacos de fertilizantes naturales “guano de corral” para sus sembríos.
texts.en:
Antonio, age 47, is married to Elva.  They have five children, but they now only live with four of them.  The house where they have lived for three years is his aunt’s.

“My son will study for a professional career, and I therefore want to increase my income.  That way I will give him a better quality of life,” he states.

His main income was centered on agriculture.  However, four years ago, thanks to MFP, he got a “motocarro” [three wheeled motorized vehicle].  He works with it every day transporting the people from his area.  “When I started I did not have a lot of competition.  In time, there were more motocarros.  However, I still continue getting income,” he comments.  He now wishes to improve his motocarro because it needs general maintenance.

He belongs to the “Santiago de Chauca” communal bank.  This is his second loan with MFP.  He pledges to make his payments punctually.  Antonio will use the loan to buy a new motor for his motocarro.  If there is enough money left over, he will get ten sacks of natural fertilizers, “guana de corral,” for his crops.

loans.use: to buy a new motor for his motocarro.  If there is enough money left over, he will get ten sacks of natural fertilizers “guana de corral” for his crops.

loans.name: Earb's Group

texts.en:
A citizen from a rural village located in the Kror Kor district of Pursat province, Cambodia, Earb is 54 years old. She is married and has seven children, two are daughters who are still dependent on her as they are still in school. She has been in the rice farming and pig-raising business for almost twenty years. The current businesses earn her about 10,000 KHR and she manages to save about 4,000 KHR per day after daily expenses.  

The main challenge for her is the low crop yield caused by drought. To overcome this challenge, she is leading her group consisting of three members to apply for a loan with VisionFund, Kiva’s partner. She is in her fourth loan cycle and she successfully repaid the past loans, which have enabled her to better support her family and the current businesses. 

Earb is going to use her portion of the loan to buy fertilizer for her farmland and use part of it to buy pig feed. She hopes to make more income so as to improve her lifestyle.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for her farmland

loans.name: Zareena

texts.en:
Zareena is 47-year-old woman, mother of three sons and a daughter, living in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She is very hard-working and an independent woman. By stitching clothes, she help her husband to meet the family needs and her children's education expenses.  

Zareena has requested a loan from KIVA partner BRAC Pakistan for purchasing a sewing machine for the expansion of her business. She has been operating her business very efficiently and honestly for the past eight years and her clients always appreciate her work. 

Zareena is hopeful about her business success as a result of the loan investment.

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine.

loans.name: Marie

texts.fr: Marie est est une femme de 47 ans mariée, père de 6 enfants dont l'age varie entre 10 et 26 ans 4 vont encore à l'école. Elle a ouvert une alimentation pres de son domicile dans un quartier de la capitale qu'il gere depuis 10 ans deja. Son petit commerce fonctionne grace à son acceuiel chaleureux et à longue experience dans ce domaine et la clientele qu'elle a acquise avec le temps. Sa clientèle devient importante et là, elle n'arrive plus à sa satisfaire à cause de la petitesse de son capital qui l'oblige à acheter en détail.Celle-ci se tourne parfois vers la concurrence, d'où l'importance de ce crédit en ce moment pour sa structure pour renforcer son petit fond de commerce pour diversifier sa marchandise (riz, sel, l'eau minerale,cartons de sucres, des friandise,...), et pouvoir augmenter sa marge bénéficiaire. Serges réinvestira une partie de son bénéfice dans l’activité pour couvrir les besoins de son secteur et l'autre partie lui permettra de subvenir à ses besoins quotidiens et ceux de sa famille.
texts.en:
Marie is a 47-year-old woman who is married and the father of six children, from 10 to 26 years old, of whom four are still in school. She opened a grocery store near her home in a district in the capital that she has been running for ten years already. Her small business is doing well, thanks to her warm welcomes, long experience in this domain, and a customer base she has acquired over time.

Her customer base is becoming significant, so she no longer can satisfy the need due to her meager capital, which compels her to maker her purchases at the retail level. Her customers sometimes turn toward the competition, thus the importance of the current loan for her shop to bolster her small business fund, so as to diversify her merchandise (rice, salt, mineral water, boxes of sugar, sweets, …) and to increase her profit margins. 

Marie will reinvest part of her profits into her business to cover the needs of her sector. The other part will enable her to meet her day-to-day needs and those of her family.

loans.use: to buy essentials in bulk (rice, soap, salt, flour...)

loans.name: Lubna

texts.en:
Lubna is a 25-year-old married woman and the mother of a son living in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She is an independent and hard-working woman. For the last two years, she has been running a beauty salon. With her little income she helps her husband to meet the family's needs and her son's education expenses. She is knowledgeable about beauty services such as hair dressing, make-up, and laser and as a result her clients always appreciate her work. 

She has requested a loan from Kiva partner BRAC Pakistan so that she can expand her beauty salon. Her biggest dream is to move forward so that she can lead a better life with dignity.

loans.use: To expand her beauty salon.

loans.name: Juna Elia

texts.en:
Juna  is a 25-year-old  businesswoman  who lives in Juba. She is married and has one child aged 3. Her child does not go to school yet. 

Juna  runs a fruit selling business and has been in business for 3 years. She has no  employees. She heard about Finance Sudan through  other clients. She is taking a loan of  3500 sdg to purchase bananas, aples  and many other items.  In addition to this business, she has no other source of income.

In 5 years, Juna  would like to expand her  business and open a big shop. Her  major challenges include high prices in the market. Juna says she is happy about the loans given by Finance Sudan  through Kiva.

loans.use: to buy items like bananas, apples, sweet oranges, etc

loans.name: Stéphanie

texts.fr: Stéphane est un femme de 44 ans mariée, mère de 6 enfants de 8 et 21 ans, deux vont à l'école. Elle est commerçante et  exerce une activité de commerce en détail où elle vend des vivres frais   (plantains) dans un marché de la place e. Elle aimerait agrandir son activité en allant acheter elle-même ses produits dans les brousses(un pick up de plantain), çalui évitera les ruptures de stocks qu'elle a tout le temps. ce crédit lui permettra non seulement de satisfaire sa clientèle déjà grandissante, mais aussi d'augmenter ses bénéfices. Bénéfices qui lui permettront de subvenir aux besoins de sa famille, économiser pour leurs scolarités et avec le temps, d'agrandir son fond de commerce et ouvrir un nouveau point de vente.
texts.en:
Stéphane is a 44 year old woman, married, mother to 6 children from 8 to 21 years old of whom 2 go to school. She is a shopkeeper and her business sells retail where she sells fresh foods (plantains) in a local market. She would like to expand her business by going to buy her products herself in the bush (a plantain pick-up), which would avoid the stock shortages that she has all the time. 

This loan will allow her not only to satisfy her already growing clientèle, but also to increase her profits. Profits that will allow her to meet the needs of her family, save for their schooling and with time, to expand her business and open a new point of sale.

loans.use: to buy a pick-up of plantains.

loans.name: Naila's Group

texts.en:
Naila is a 27-year-old married women with three children, and resident of Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Since 2007, her husband has been driving a taxi, which is the only source of income for his family.

Naila is a member of two-person lending group and has requested a loan from Kiva partner BRAC Pakistan to cover the cost of repairing the taxi her husband drives. This will not only help in improving the taxi's condition but will help in improving her family income as well.

Note: In the picture, Naila is carrying a pass book in her hand.

loans.use: To repair her husband's taxi.

loans.name: Ratana's Group

texts.en:
A rural villager from the Pursat province’s Kror Kor district of Cambodia, Ratana is 32 years old and married. She has four children, two daughters and two sons, all of whom are dependent on her and still in school. She is a rice farmer while her husband is a motor taxi driver to earn additional family income. They have been in this business for several years and can earn about 10,000 KHR per day. 

This is the second microloan for Ratana’s group of two with VisionFund and she is the group leader. The first loan has helped her better support her family. Now she and her co-member are seeking a new loan loan with VisionFund in amount of 300,000 KHR each. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy fertilizer for her farmland. She hopes this loan will enable her to increase her crop yields so as to make a better living.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for her farmland

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy crates of okra and spices.

loans.name: Luz Mariela

texts.es:
Luz Mariela se encuentra casada y tiene 6 hijos, y para sostener los gastos de su hogar, contribuye económicamente junto con su esposo gracias a un taller de confección que tiene donde ofrece el servicio de confección a terceros.  Cuando comenzó con su taller tenía tan solo una máquina básica para confeccionar y sus pedidos eran muy pocos, pero gracias al esfuerzo que ha hecho y todo el empuje que ha puesto en su negocio ahora tiene la oportunidad de generar 3 empleos y las condiciones económicas de su hogar han mejorado considerablemente. Además de esto, también ha logrado comenzar a sacar su propia línea de ropa, la cual también tiene muy buenos pedidos por parte de sus clientes, y debido a que tiene grandes pedidos y no cuenta con el capital suficiente para responder por ellos, Luz Mariela busca un préstamo que le permita comprar insumos como telas e hilos y así poder responder a los pedidos que tiene por parte de sus clientes.

Su mayor sueño es lograr salir adelante con su taller y poder brindarles educación de buena calidad a sus 6 hijos. Además, espera que las dificultades económicas que sufren en su hogar puedan ser superadas con su negocio.
texts.en:
Luz Mariela is married and has six children. In order to contribute to household expenses along with her husband, she runs a sewing business.
When she started the business she had only a basic sewing machine and very few orders. But now thanks to the effort and  hard work she put in, she has enough work for three employees and her financial situation has greatly improved.

In addition, Luz Mariela has started her own line of clothing and has received many orders for the clothes from her customers. Because of these orders and because she doesn't have any capital, she is seeking a loan to buy supplies such as fabric and thread so she can complete the orders.

Her greatest dream is to make a success of her workshop and to be able to provide her six children with a good quality education. As well she hopes that the economic hardships suffered by her family will be overcome by her business success.

loans.use: buy supplies such as fabric and thread so she can complete the orders from her customers

loans.name: Marina

texts.es:
Marina es viuda  y tiene dos hijos con los cuales no vive por que ambos ya son independientes, vive en casa propia ubicada en la zona San Pedro de la ciudad de La Paz.
Ella es maestra jubilada y actualmente percibe renta de su jubilación y en su tiempo libre teje chompas y posteriormente las vende para tener más ingresos ya que debe cubrir sus gastos de alimentación y pago de servicios básicos.
El crédito lo requiere para la refacción de un muro de contención en su vivienda ya que presenta filtraciones internas y desea tener más seguridad más que todo en tiempos de lluvia.
El sueño de Marina es construir una casa más grande para poder alojar a sus hijos ya que vive sola.
Es la segunda vez que solicita crédito junto a IMPRO y la primera vez con KIVA.
texts.en:
Marina is a widow and has two children who no longer live with her since they are now independent.  She lives in her own house located in the city of La Paz’s San Pedro zone.  She is a retired teacher who currently earns her pension and in her free time knits sweaters to then sell in order to earn more income because she must cover her food and utility costs.

She needs the loan to repair a retaining wall at home because it has internal seepage and she wants to have more security especially during the rainy season.  Marina’s dream is to build a larger house so that her children can move in with her because she lives alone.  This is the second time she’s asked for an IMPRO loan and the first with KIVA.

loans.use: to repair a retaining wall.

loans.name: Amina

texts.en:
Amina is 57 years old. She is a hard-working woman with a great desire to be a successful businesswoman. She is a divorcee and bringing up her two children alone. Amina tries to comfort her children with all modern conveniences. In order to improve their living condition, 11 yeas ago she began her own business.

She sells a variety of women’s clothes. She stores and displays her merchandise in a local market. Amina manages her business alone. Also she has additional income from a café. She has own café in the market where she sells her goods. There are some workers in her café and they serve people with high quality.

This is Amina's 11th loan with Imon International Organization, and she is grateful for its financial support in helping her to realize her plans.  She is asking for a loan of 10,000 TJS to buy seasonable women’s clothes in order to increase her business. She awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy seasonable women’s clothing

loans.name: Chansey's Group

texts.en:
Aged 28 years old, Chansey is a married mother of two children living in a rural village of the Kror Kor district of Pursat province. Rice farming is the main source of family’s income and her husband supplements family income by working as a laborer in the local area. They have been in this rice farming business for six years and she is able to earn about KHR 10,000 per day and can manage to save about KHR 4,000 each day after daily expenses.

Chansey has been with VisionFund for three cycles and completely paid back the loans while the other group member has been with VisionFund for one cycle. The past loans have helped Chansey to have sufficient food for her family. Now she is leading the group of two to apply for a loan. Chansey is going to use her portion to buy fertilizers for her farmland and use a portion of it to pay for laborers. She hopes this loan will enable her to earn a good living.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers for her farmland

loans.name: Elie

texts.en: Elie is 30 years old and is married with four children between the ages 2 and 6 years old. Elie sells shoes. He has five years of experience in this work. Elie has requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to purchase more shoes for resale. With any profits, he will be able to save money for his future, reinvest in his business, and pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: To purchase more shoes to sell.

loans.name: Carlos Enrique

texts.es:
Carlos es una persona muy trabajadora que ha logrado levantar su propio negocio a pesar de las grandes dificultades que se le han presentado en la vida. Desde hace un tiempo se quedó sin empleo y así sin fuente de ingresos para el sostenimiento de los gastos de su hogar donde convive con su esposa y sus 6 hijos, y en busca de la fuente de ingresos para su hogar encontró la manera de montar su propio negocio de venta de prendas de vestir y artículos de uso personal. Desde hace un tiempo tiene su propio negocio y la calidad de vida de su familia ha mejorado considerablemente, y gracias a las buenas ventas que tiene a veces su esposa le debe colaborar con la atención del negocio. Como no cuenta con un gran capital para surtir su negocio, Carlos busca un préstamo para comprar productos de uso personal que se han venido agotando gracias a sus ventas.

Su sueño es que su negocio siga creciendo y le siga permitiendo brindarles a sus 6 hijos y su esposa una buena calidad de vida y mejores oportunidades económicas para progresar.
texts.en:
Carlos is a very hardworking person who has succeeded in developing his own business despite the great difficulties life has presented him.  Some time ago he became unemployed with no source of income to support his household where he lives with his wife and six children.  Seeking a source of income for his home he found the way of setting up his own business selling clothes and personal use items.  

For some time now he’s had his own business and his family’s quality of life has improved considerably.  Thanks to the good sales the business has his wife has to help him sometimes with it.  Carlos is looking for a loan to buy personal use products that he’s been running out of thanks to his sales.  His dream is that the business continues to grow and continues allowing him to provide his six children and his wife with a good quality of life and better economic opportunities for progress.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise.

loans.name: Gregorio Antonio

texts.es:
Gregorio es una persona que siempre se ha caracterizado por ser muy trabajador y esto le ha permitido brindar una buena calidad de vida a sus hijos a pesar de todas las dificultades que se le han presentado en la vida. Anteriormente trabajaba en la actividad de la construcción, pero debido a problemas de salud se vio en la obligación de dejar este trabajo y buscar una nueva fuente de ingresos; fue así como montó su venta de frutas y con la cual lleva 3 años generando los ingresos que se requieren en su hogar. A pesar de que este negocio no le brinda toda la estabilidad económica que antes tenía, su trabajo le permite tener un buen estado de salud y por esto continúa trabajando fuertemente para hacerlo crecer y que también crezcan sus ingresos. Gracias a que sus clientes se lo han venido pidiendo, Gregorio busca un préstamo para comprar surtido de dulces y así diversificar las ventas de su negocio.

Su sueño es que este negocio le permita brindarles a sus 2 hijos el acceso a una educación de buena calidad y puedan salir adelante en un futuro. Además, sueña con que su salud le permita seguir trabajando y sacar su familia adelante.
texts.en: Gregorio is a person who has always stood out for being very hardworking and this has allowed him to provide his children with a good quality of life despite all the difficulties life has presented him with.  He used to work in construction but due to health reasons had to leave this type of work and seek a new source of income.  This is how he started to sell fruit and has been earning household income this way for three years.  Despite the fact that this business does not provide the level of economic stability he used to have, his work does allow him to be in good health so he continues working hard to make it grow so that his income will grow too.  Because his customers have been asking him to, Gregorio is looking for a loan to buy an assortment of candy to diversify his sales.  His dream is that the business will allow him to provide his two children with access to a good quality education so that they can get ahead in the future.   He also dreams that his health will allow him to continue working and moving his family forward.

loans.use: to buy assorted candies to sell.

loans.name: Yuliya

texts.ru:
Юлия живет в Мелитополе и уже несколько лет ведет свой бизнес. Она торгует конфетами, печеньем и сладостями на одном из крупных рынков города. 

Юлии нужен кредит в размере 5 000 гривен для того, чтобы пополнить товарные запасы сладостей, разнообразив свой ассортимент. Юлия планирует в будущем развивать свой бизнес, повторно вкладывая полученные средства в свое дело, а также улучшать быт семьи, обеспечивая мужа и двух своих дочерей всем необходимым.
texts.en:
Yuliya lives and runs her business in Melitopol, Ukraine. She sells candies, cookies and sweets on one of city's largest markets. Yuliya needs a loan to refill and diversify her inventory of sweets for sale. 
Yuliya plans to invest profits from sales into the business and expand it in the future. She also wants to increase her family's quality of life and to provide them with everything they need.

loans.use: to refill her inventory of sweets for sale.

loans.name: Regina

texts.en:
Regina is a married woman. She has three children with ages ranging from 10 years to 18 years old. She describes herself to be dedicated to her work. She operates a retail store where she sells items such as shoes, clothes, etc. She has been involved in this business for 3 years. Her business is located along a busy highway  and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of funds for improving the business. 

Regina will use the Kes 8,700 loan to purchase a water tank for home use. Her business goal is to own a big boutique within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will be a great millionaire. Besides the retail store, Regina does farming. She had received a loan of Kes 20,000 which she repaid.

loans.use: to buy a water tank for home use

loans.name: Victorienne

texts.fr: Victorinne est une femme de 47 ans mariée, mère de 2 enfants de 16 et 24 ans, tous deux vont à l'école. Elle exerce une activité de commerce en détail où elle vend des vivres frais et secs (riz, haricots, arachides, tomate...) dans un marché de la place en fonction des saisons. Elle aimerait agrandir son activité en achetant ses produits en gros (sacs), çalui évitera les ruptures de stocks qu'elle a tout le temps. ce crédit lui permettra non seulement de satisfaire sa clientèle déjà grandissante, mais aussi d'augmenter ses bénéfices. Bénéfices qui lui permettront de subvenir aux besoins de sa famille  dont elle a la charge en partie, économiser pour leurs scolarités et avec le temps, d'agrandir son fond de commerce et ouvrir un nouveau point de vente.
texts.en:
Victorienne is a 47 year old woman, married, mother to 2 children of 16 and 24 years of age, both go to school. She has a business selling retail where she sells fresh food and dried goods (rice, beans, groundnuts, tomato...) in a local market according to the seasons. She would like to expand her business by buying her products wholesale (bags), which would avoid the stock shortages that she has all the time.

This loan will allow her not only to satisfy her already growing clientèle, but also to increase her profits. Profits that will allow her to meet the needs of her family for which she is partly responsible, to save for their schooling and with time, to expand her business and open another point of sale.

loans.use: to buy bags of rice, beans, groundnuts.

loans.name: Ty's Group

texts.en:
Ty is aged 41 and living in a rural area of the Sampov Meas district of Pursat province, Cambodia. She has two children, one is a son who is dependent on her and still in school. She has been working at rice farming on 3.5 hectares of farmland and supplements the family’s income through selling firewood. She has been in these businesses for three years and twelve years, respectively. She is able to earn about KHR 30,000 per day. The main challenge for her business is low crop yields from crops ruined by drought.

This is the fourth microloan for Ty’s group of four with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. She completely paid back the past loans which have helped her to relieve the family’s burden. Now leading her group to apply for a loan with VisionFund, Ty will use her portion to buy fertilizers for her farmland and use part of it to pay for plowing. She hopes to increase her income from her current businesses so as to set aside some money to buy a decent motorcycle for use in her family.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for her farmland

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
For the past 10 years Rebecca has been engaged in a livestock business, raising 7 sows, 30 piglets and 16 others for fattening. Her years of sacrifices and hard work have been really worth it, enabling her to educate her three children.

Rebecca is requesting a loan of P8000 to buy hog feed, vitamins and vaccines in order to ensure the proper growth of her hogs. These purchases will result in greater income and contribute to her continued success.

loans.use: to buy hog feed, vitamins and vaccines for her livestock business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase input items, such as fabric, thread and tape for completing client orders.

loans.name: Maria Llaned

texts.es:
Maria es una madre soltera cabeza de familia de sus 3 hijos y para poder sostener los gastos de su hogar tiene una venta de comidas rápidas en la cual trabaja todos los días en busca de progresar junto con sus hijos. Hace unos 26 años tiene este negocio y gracias a esto en un principio aportaba económicamente junto con el padre de sus hijos para que su hogar tuviera una buena calidad de vida, pero desde que el padre de sus hijos los abandonó esta ha sido la fuente de ingresos que le permite sostener los gastos de su hogar. Con este negocio ha podido sacar adelante su familia y sus hijos han logrado tener acceso a una educación de buena calidad, y por esto sigue esforzándose diariamente para que sus ventas sigan creciendo y sus hijos sigan teniendo cada vez una mejor calidad de vida y mejores oportunidades económicas para progresar. Debido a que tiene permiso de ubicar su puesto de venta de comidas en un lugar donde esta muy lleno de arena, en las temporadas de invierno esto se hace un pantano y sus ventas disminuyen considerablemente; por esto Maria busca un préstamo para arreglar el suelo donde ubica su puesto de venta de comidas y así no empantanar su negocio cuando llueve.

Su sueño es que sus hijos salgan adelante y en un futuro espera que puedan ingresar a una universidad. Además, tiene el gran anhelo de que algún día pueda conseguir su casa propia.
texts.en:
María is a single mother head of household.  She has three children.   In order to cover her household expenses she sells fast-food every day seeking to make progress with her children.  She’s had the business for about 26 years and thanks to it was able in the beginning to contribute together with her children’s father to provide a good quality of life for their children.  But since the father of her children abandoned them, this has been the source of income that makes it possible for her to cover household expenses.  She’s been able to move her family forward and her children have been able to have access to a good quality education thanks to this business which is why she continues striving every day so that sales will continue to increase and her children will continue to have better quality of life and better economic opportunities for progress every day.

Because her permit to sell fast-food is for a location that’s very sandy during the rainy season the area around her stand becomes like a swamp and her sales drop off considerably which is why María is seeking a loan to improve the land her food stand is located on so that it won’t become swampy in the rainy season any longer.  Her dream is that her children move forward and be able to attend university in the future.  In addition, she greatly hopes someday to acquire a house of her own.

loans.use: to repair the floor where his business is located.

loans.name: Gladis Amparo

texts.es:
Gladis es una madre soltera cabeza de hogar de sus 2 hijos de 14 y 16 años de edad, y tiene una papelería donde también ofrece el servicio de cibercafé con la que genera los ingresos que requiere en su hogar para sacar su familia adelante. Pero debido a que su madre se encontraba con dificultades de salud, se vio en la obligación de cerrar durante un tiempo su papelería y poder estar al cuidado de ella; por esto ahora que ya su madre se encuentra en buen estado de salud, Gladis busca reabrir su papelería y cibercafé y continuar trabajando fuertemente para generar los ingresos que requiere para el sostenimiento de su familia, por esto requiere de un préstamo para surtir con productos de papelería su negocio y comprar un computador para seguir ofreciendo un buen servicio de cibercafé.

Su sueño es que su negocio siga creciendo y le permita seguir generando los ingresos que requiere en su hogar para que sus hijos y su madre tengan una buena calidad de vida y mejores oportunidades económicas para progresar.
texts.en:
Gladis is a single mother head of household.  She has two children who are 14 and 16 years of age.  She has a stationery shop where she also offers Internet café service that generates income needed for her home to move her family forward.  

Because her mother was having some health problems recently, she had to close the shop for a time in order to care for her but now that her mother is in good health again Gladis wants to reopen her stationery shop and Internet café and to continue to work hard to generate the income she needs to support her family.  To do so, she needs a loan to buy office supplies and to buy a computer to continue offering good Internet café service.

Her dream is that he business continues growing and making it possible for her to generate income needed at home so that her children and her mother can have a good quality of life and better economic opportunities for progress.

loans.use: to buy office supplies and to buy a computer.

loans.name: Jamal

texts.en: Jamal lives with his wife. The couple is involved in agriculture. They raise cattle and cultivate tomatoes, cucumbers, onions, and grapes. Jamal needs to purchase grass and barley to feed the cattle. He also wants to purchase fertilizer for the land cultivation. This loan will help Jamal to implement his plans and keep gathering stable income from the farm.

loans.use: to pay for grass, barley, and fertilizer.

loans.name: Nader

texts.en:
Nader is a 39-year-old man. He is married and a father to one son.

For the past four years, Nader has been operating a vehicle repair workshop, which has been a profitable project, but not enough to cover his family's cost of living.

Nader is requesting a loan of 1,000 USD from FATEN to help him cover the costs of purchasing a new vehicle repair kit. This will improve Nader's work quality and increase demand from his customers to repair their vehicles. This will increase his income and offer his family better living conditions. Nader is photographed in the workshop.

loans.use: To purchase a new vehicle repair kit.

loans.name: Christia Lyn

texts.en:
Christia Lyn is now 24 years old, married, and has one infant child. To generate income, she chose to manage an eatery located beside the public highway while her husband works in one of the microfinance institutions. She aimed to strengthen the business and make it a viable source of income. She has been operating it for almost two years and usually earns a profit of 10,000 PHP/month that she usually spends for their food and clothing and saves for their future. 

She planned to prepare more recipes daily to satisfy her customers' demand but due to insufficient capital, she is asking for an additional of 50,000 PHP to buy raw ingredients such as pork, fish, chicken, soft drinks, chips, and mineral waters to sell in the eatery. She believes that her strong faith and determination will help her to improve the business and to make her dream comes true.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients, chips, soft drinks, and mineral waters to sell.

loans.name: El Hadji Samba

texts.fr:
Monsieur El Hadji Samba âgé de 33 ans, est un jeune menuisier qui travaille avec un ami .Il demande un crédit de 100000 FCFA pour acheter de la matière première : du bois, de la colle, du contre plaqué, pour fabriquer des lits et pouvoir le revendre avant les fêtes de Korité (qui marque la fin du ramadan).
Il gère sa petite famille puisqu’il est marié et père de famille. Avec un fond suffisant, il aimerait agrandir son activité et ouvrir un grand atelier.
texts.en:
Mr. El Hadji Samba, 33 years old, is a young carpenter who works with a friend.  He is requesting a loan of 100,000 FCFA to buy materials such as wood, glue, and plywood to make beds to sell before the festival of Korité (which marks the end of Ramadan).
He is married and the father of a small family.  With sufficient funds, he would like to grow his business and open a large workshop.

loans.use: to buy wood, plywood, and glue for making beds to sell.

loans.name: Luz Mery

texts.es:
Luz  Mery  es una señora  de 52 años de edad, ella vive con uno de sus hijos, en una comunidad llamada Osa, localizada en Caña Blancal, ubicada en la provincia de Puntarenas. Está comunidad se destaca por ser una zona rural muy visitada por sus hermosas playas  y la gran variedad de vida silvestre, las principales actividades económicas son las turísticas y agropecuarias.

Luz  Mery  tiene una tienda de abarrotes, con la cual suple las necesidades de  algunos productos de consumo diario de los vecinos de  la comunidad,  ella ha visto como poco a poco su negocio crece y la demanda de productos cada vez es  mayor , ya que  se han sentido satisfechos con el servicio brindado, pero a la vez   exigen variedad de mercadería.

Lo que en estos momentos solicita doña Luz Mery es un micro crédito de un millón cuarenta mil colones (¢1.040.000) , precisamente  para comprar variedad de mercadería y satisfacer las necesidades de su clientela.

Ella es socia de la Empresa de Crédito Comunal de Caña Blancal, una de las 110 organizaciones socias de EDESA en Costa Rica. Con este préstamo  espera crecer más a nivel personal y económico. También destaca que gracias a este tipo de organizaciones y medios facilitadores de crédito puede alcanzar mayores metas.
texts.en:
Luz Mery is 52 years of age and lives with her two children in a community called Osa located in Caña Blancal in the province of Puntarenas.  This community, known for its beautiful beaches and diverse wildlife, is primarily supported by tourism and agriculture.  

Luz Mery owns a grocery store which supplies the local community with daily consumer products.  She noticed that her business has been slowly growing and demand for products is getting stronger.  Now that her customers feel satisfied with her services they are requesting a wider range of products.  

At them moment, Luz Mery is seeking a loan of 1.04 million colones (¢1,040,000) to purchase products to satisfy customer demand.  She is a member of the Empresa de Crédito Comunal de Caña Blancal, one of 110 member organizations of EDESA in Costa Rica.  With this loan she hopes to better herself economically and personally.  She also notes that thanks to these types of credit organiztions she is able to achieve her goals.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise for her business.

loans.name: John

texts.es:
John es divorciado y tiene tres hijos que están en etapa escolar, viven en la casa de sus padres ocupando una habitación, la casa esta ubicada en la zona Buenos Aires de la ciudad de La Paz.
El estudió hasta la secundaria y actualmente trabaja como chofer por más de doce horas al día y hasta altas horas de la noche ya que es el único que cubre los gastos de alimentación, educación y pago de servicios básicos de su familia.
El crédito lo requiere para el cambio de motor de su vehiculo ya que es muy importante por que es su única fuente de ingresos para mantener a su familia.
El sueño de John, es mejorar sus ingresos y adquirir una casa en anticrético ya que desea dar más comodidad a su familia ya que son cuatro integrantes de esa forma también mejorar su calidad de vida.
Es la segunda vez que solicita crédito junto a IMPRO y KIVA.
texts.en:
John’s divorced and has three school age children.  They live in his parents’ house occupying one room.  The house is located in the city of La Paz’s Buenos Aires zone.

He studied up to secondary school and currently works more than 12 hours daily well into the night as a driver since he’s the only one covering food, school and basic utility costs for his family.   He needs the loan to replace the engine in his vehicle because it’s very important since this is his only source of family income.

John’s dream is to improve his income and to buy a house using the ‘anticrético’ modality [transaction whereby a property owner requests a "loan" from you in exchange for housing, which must be paid back to you at the end of your contract. If your loan is not repaid, the property owner could lose the property to you] because he wants to provide more comfort for his family since they are four; they will also improve their quality of life this way.

This is the second time he’s asked for an IMPRO and KIVA loan.

loans.use: to replace the engine in his vehicle.

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
Judith is 23 years old and married to Josphat who is a businessman. They are blessed with one child aged 10 months. She has been in the salon business for two years and currently earns a monthly income of 18,000 KES. 

This is her first loan with KADET and she plans to use the loan amount to buy stock for her salon with items such as oil, chemicals, braids, weaves and treatment. The anticipated profits will be used to educate her child.

Her hopes and dreams are to become the best salonist in Mlolongo.

loans.use: To buy oil, weaves, braids, and treatment.

loans.name: Joseph Daniel

texts.en:
Joseph  is a 35-year-old  businesswoman  who lives in Juba. She is married and has four children between the ages of 3 and 11. Three of them go to school.

Joseph  runs a food selling business and has been in business for three years. She has no  employees. She heard about Finance Sudan through  other clients. She is taking a loan of  2500 sdg to purchase flour, oil  and many other items.  In addition to this business, she has no other source of income.

In 5 years Joseph  would like to expand her  business and open a big restaurant. Her  major challenges include high prices in the market. Joseph  says she is happy about the loans given by Finance Sudan  through Kiva.

loans.use: to buy items like flour for making bread, etc

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to build an area where he is able to milk his cows.  He is currently doing this out in the open.

loans.name: Pedro Luis

texts.es:
Pedro es una persona muy trabajadora y gracias a esto ha podido sacar adelante su familia con los ingresos que le genera su taller de fabricación de calzado, el cual tiene hace unos 20 años y gracias a esta experiencia es reconocido por ofrecer trabajos de muy buena calidad. La actividad la aprendió de unos amigos que se dedicaban a esto y durante un tiempo se la enseñaron a Pedro, y luego de esto con unos ahorros consiguió la maquinaria básica y desde entonces tiene este negocio como su fuente de ingresos para que su familia salga adelante y pueda tener una buena calidad de vida. Gracias a que en los últimos días ha tenido una gran cantidad de pedidos de calzado, pero como no cuenta con la materia prima suficiente para responder por ellos, Pedro busca un préstamo para comprar materia prima para la elaboración de calzado y responder a los grandes pedidos que tiene por parte de sus clientes.

Su mayor sueño es que este negocio salga adelante y siga siendo la fuente de ingresos para que su familia tenga el sustento necesario para tener una buena calidad de vida. Además, Pedro sueña con que sus hijos tengan una educación de buena calidad y aspira a que su negocio les pueda pagar esta educación.
texts.en:
Pedro is a very hardworking person with a strong desire to get ahead and provide for his family. He operates a workshop and makes shoes, using the income he generates to support his family. He opened his workshop 20 years ago, and is well known for his high quality work and products. He learned the shoe-making craft from one of his friends who taught him many skills, and, after a time working with and for his friend, he was able to save up some money to purchase basic machinery and open his own shop. His workshop is the source of income for his family, and their hope for a better quality of life.

Recently, he has received many customer orders for shoes, but he does not have the raw materials necessary to fulfill those orders. Therefore, Pedro is requesting this loan, and he plans to use the support from the loan to purchase raw materials for making shoes. He hopes this will help to keep up with client demand and all his present orders.

His dream is to expand and grow his business, and to provide for his family and improve their quality of life. Pedro also dreams of giving his children a high quality education, and hopes his business will help them realize their dreams.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials for making shoes and responding to customer orders.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy merchandise.

loans.name: Qamil

texts.en:
Qamil is forty years old. He is married and has five children ranging from sixteen to four years old. He is living in a small village. Qamil is working as a security guard in a food market. His job is the family’s main source of income. 

His wife loves her children very much and she spends most of the time taking care of them as a stay-at-home mom. Qamil’s family has had a longstanding problem with their toilet. The money he generates is not enough to pay for repairing the toilet. For the first time, he is asking for a loan to buy a water heater and other essential parts for renovation. 

He hopes this loan will improve the health of his family. His goal is to improve living conditions and ensure an income for his family. Qamil is very grateful to KosInvest – KIVA lenders for improving the family's living conditions and standard of living.

loans.use: To buy a water heater and other essential parts for renovation

loans.name: Wilfrida

texts.en:
Wilfrida is 32 years old. She is the mother of two children and lives with her spouse, who is an electrician. They rent the house they live in in the city of Mombasa in the coastal region of Kenya, where she works selling dried fish and fresh fruit, which is what she has done since she began her business. 

Wilfrida needs the loan to buy merchandise to stock her business. She needs to purchase more fruit and sacks of dried fish for sale. With the profits obtained from this loan, Wilfrida is planning on improving her business. Her dream is to own a retail shop in future.

loans.use: to purchase more fruit and sacks of dried fish for sale.

loans.name: Luis Alberto

texts.es:
Luis Alberto tiene 4 hijos y desde que la madre de sus hijos los abandonó, las responsabilidades económicas están a su cargo; para esto trabaja fuertemente todos los días en su negocio de venta de comidas rápidas generando los ingresos necesarios para el sostenimiento de los gastos de su hogar. Desde hace unos 8 años aproximadamente comenzó con este negocio en busca de mejores oportunidades económicas para su hogar, y gracias al esfuerzo que ha puesto en su negocio, este ha crecido considerablemente y ahora tiene la posibilidad de contar con una gran clientela. A pesar de que su negocio ha crecido mucho, las dificultades económicas en su hogar no han desaparecido, pues debe brindarles educación a sus 4 hijos y ofrecerles todo lo necesario para que tengan una buena calidad de vida, por esto se esfuerza cada día más en busca de mejores ingresos para su familia y así prosperar económicamente. Debido a que sus ventas se están incrementando, pero no cuenta con un capital suficiente para respaldarlas, Luis Alberto busca un préstamo que le permita comprar insumos como desechables, salsas, y otros más que se han ido agotando en su negocio.

Su mayor sueño es seguir creciendo con su negocio y algún día lograr ubicarlo en un local fijo, de modo que pueda atender mejor a sus clientes y sus ventas aumenten considerablemente. También anhela con que sus hijos tengan la posibilidad de acceder a una educación universitaria y poderles brindar una estabilidad económica en el hogar.
texts.en:
Luis Alberto has four children and ever since the mother of his children abandoned them economic responsibilities have been in his hands.  Because of this he works hard every day in his business selling fast-food generating income needed to cover household expenses.

He started the business approximately 8 years ago looking for better economic opportunities for his home and thanks to the effort he’s put into his business it has grown considerably and now he has a well-established clientele.  Despite his business’ considerable growth, economic difficulties at home have not disappeared because he must provide his four children with an education and with everything needed so that they can have a good quality of life.  Because of this he strives still more each day seeking improved income for his family to make economic progress that way.  Because his sales have increased but he does not have sufficient capital to back them up, Luis Alberto is looking for a loan to buy supplies like disposables, sauces and others that he’s been running out of in the business.

His greatest dream is to continue growing with his business and someday be able to establish it in a fixed locale to provide better customer service and so that his sales will increase considerably.  He also hopes that his children will be able to have access to a university education and to be able to provide them with economic stability at home.

loans.use: to buy ingredients and supplies.

loans.name: Isabel Cristina

texts.es:
Isabel es una joven emprendedora que desde hace bastantes años cuando estaba en el colegio comenzó vendiendo dulces y galletas para generar sus propios ingresos y poder contribuir en su hogar para que sus padres pudieran gozar de unas mejores oportunidades económicas. Debido a que en su hogar no tienen grandes recursos económicos, Isabel comenzó a ver en la venta de artículos la posibilidad de ser una fuente de ingresos para poder pagar sus estudios universitarios, y fue así como comenzó a vender productos de uso personal como lociones, cosméticos, entre otros más. Gracias a este negocio tiene la posibilidad de estudiar en la universidad y por eso siempre busca que este siga creciendo para poder salir adelante. Con el esfuerzo que ha puesto ha logrado captar una gran cantidad de clientes, por esto ahora busca un préstamo para surtir su negocio con productos de uso personal como cosméticos y responder a los grandes pedidos que tiene por parte de sus clientes.

Su mayor sueño es que este negocio le siga brindando la posibilidad de estudiar su carrera profesional y también contribuir en su hogar para que sus padres puedan gozar de una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Isabel’s a young entrepreneur who since several years ago when she was still in high school started selling candy and cookies to generate her own income and be able to contribute at home so that her parents could enjoy better economic opportunities.  Because her home does not have many economic resources, Isabel started selling items hoping it would be a source of income to pay for her university education and this is how she started to sell personal use items like lotions and cosmetics, among others.  Thanks to this business she’s able to attend university and this is why she’s always hoping it will continue to grow in order to get ahead.  With the effort she’s put into it she’s managed to secure a large number of customers which is why she’s now looking for a loan to stock her business with personal use items like cosmetics to fill large pending orders she has from customers.  Her greatest dream is that this business will continue providing her with the possibility of studying her professional career and also contributing at home so that her parents can enjoy a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise.

loans.name: Darlleny

texts.es:
Darlleny se encuentra casada y tiene un hijo de 9 años a quien siempre le ha querido brindar el acceso a una educación de buena calidad, por esto trabaja fuertemente en su sala de belleza que tiene desde hace un año con el ánimo de generar ingresos con los que pueda contribuir económicamente en su hogar junto con su esposo para tener mejores oportunidades económicas. Anteriormente en su hogar tenían muchas dificultades económicas, pero gracias a su esfuerzo las condiciones han venido mejorando y espera que con su esfuerzo diario en el salón de belleza pueda seguir creciendo y mejorando la calidad de vida en su hogar. Debido a que no cuenta con un capital suficiente, Darlleny acude a un préstamo para comprar una silla y un secador profesional para su salón de belleza y poder prestar un mejor servicio a sus clientes.

Su mayor anhelo es que su salón de belleza le permita mejorar la calidad de vida de su esposo y su hijo de 9 años y poder salir adelante superando las dificultades que se les han presentado en la vida.
texts.en:
Darlleny is married, and has a nine-year-old son to whom she has always wanted to provide access to a good quality education. This is why she works hard in her beauty salon that she has had for one year. 

Her aim is to generate income with which she can contribute financially to the household, along with her husband, so that they can have better economic opportunities. Previously she had many financial difficulties in her home but thanks to her effort, their circumstances have been gradually improving. She  hopes that with her daily effort in the beauty salon she can continue growing and improving the quality of life in her household. 

Due to the fact that she doesn't have sufficient working capital, Darlleny is turning to a loan, in order to buy a chair and a professional hair dryer for her beauty salon, and to be able to offer a better service to her customers.

Her greatest wish is for her beauty salon to allow her to improve the quality of life of her husband and nine-year-old son, and to be able to succeed, overcoming the difficulties that have arisen in her life.

loans.use: To buy a chair and a professional hair dryer for her beauty salon, and to be able to offer a better service to her customers.

loans.name: Dulamhand

texts.en:
Dulamhand is 35 years old. She lives with her two daughters in an apartment her father owns in Songinohairhan district in Ulaanbaatar, Mongolia. Her older daughter, Solongo, is 15 years old, and her younger daughter, Namuun, is 12 years old. They are secondary school students.

Dulamhand is a female head of a household. She started a handicraft business in 2002. She paints, and also makes souvenirs and sells them. She is experienced with more than 9 years in the handicraft business. She is a honest and  quiet-natured person. She needs 2,000,000 Mongolian Tughriks (MNT) to purchase 20 pieces of leather, 40 pieces of framing, and paint.

Dulamhand's goal is to increase her profit and to save money for her childrens' higher educations.

loans.use: to purchase 20 pieces of leather, 40 pieces of framing, and paint.

loans.name: Hatmone

texts.en:
Hatmone is 64 years old. She lives in a small village. She is married and has six adult children. She spends most of the time staying at home. After the war many Kosovar families are facing with water reduction. One of them is  Hatmane’s family. 

They have a longstanding problem with water. They need every day to walk five kilometers to provide water to drink. Her husband is working as a security guard in a market. Through his work he tries to generate income for his family. The money he generates through his work is not enough to pay for opening a well.

With the requested amount Hatmone will pay for opening a new well for drinking water .For the first time she is requesting a loan to pay for opening this new well. This loan will improve her and her family’s life. She promises to make her payments punctually.

loans.use: To pay for opening a new well for drinking water

loans.name: Nadmidsuren

texts.en:
Nadmidsuren, 45 years old, lives with her husband and two children in a house in Uvurhangai province of Mongolia. Her husband has a taxi business and her children are in university.  Nadmidsuren started her clothes retailing business in 2003. With the profit she made from the business, she purchased a new house and a shipping container to house the business. Her business is sustainable. She would like to expand her business by increasing the variety of goods she sells. 

Nadmidsuren needs 3,500,000 MNT to purchase more goods because the school season will soon begin.  She is a hard-working woman who says, ''I will spend the profit from my business for my children's tuition.''

loans.use: To purchase more goods for the start of the school season

loans.name: Teresa De Jesus

texts.es:
Teresa ha tenido que atravesar por muchas dificultades en su vida, sin embargo siempre ha tenido la fortaleza para salir adelante y continuar progresando junto con su familia. Madre soltera cabeza de familia de sus 5 hijos, Teresa se separó de su esposo hace 3 años y desde entonces las responsabilidades económicas de su hogar están a su cargo, y para poder generar los ingresos para su hogar, comenzó con un taller de confección en su casa, gracias a que conocía la actividad desde hace un tiempo. Cuando empezó con el negocio solo contaba con las máquinas básicas, pero gracias a su esfuerzo y la buena calidad de sus trabajos ha logrado crecer y ahora genera un empleo para una persona muy necesitada. Debido a que sus ventas siguen creciendo, Teresa busca un préstamo para comprar una máquina cortadora que le permita realizar su trabajo con mejor calidad.

Teresa espera que de esta manera pueda tener un mejor servicio para sus clientes y el tiempo de producción se reduzca, de modo que pueda seguir respondiendo a los grandes pedidos de sus clientes. A pesar de que en su hogar las dificultades económicas persisten, Teresa espera que su negocio le permita seguir prosperando y que sus 5 hijos tengan una mejor calidad de vida y acceso a una educación de mejor calidad.
texts.en:
Teresa has had to go through many difficulties in her life.  However, she’s always found the strength to continue forward and making progress with her family.  

She’s a single mother head of household.  She has five children.  Teresa separated from her husband three years ago and since then her home’s economic responsibilities have been in her hands. 

In order to generate household income she started a sewing workshop at home because she has had these skills for some time.  When she started the business she only had basic machines but thanks to  her efforts and to the good quality of her work she’s grown and now is able to provide employment for a very needy person.  Because her sales continue growing, Teresa is looking for a loan to buy a cutting machine that will make it possible for her to do higher quality work.

Teresa hopes this way to provide better customer service and that production time will be lessened so that she can continue responding to large customer orders.  Even though economic difficulties at home persist, Teresa hopes that her business will allow her to continue making progress and that her five children will have a better quality of life and access to a better quality education.

loans.use: to buy a cutting machine.

loans.name: Rosbeny

texts.es:
Rosbeny tiene una fábrica de arepas que viene de tradición familiar y es con esta que genera ingresos para contribuir económicamente en su hogar y sacar su hijo de 18 años de edad adelante. La actividad la aprendió desde muy temprana edad gracias a que sus padres le enseñaron la actividad muy joven para que trabajara a su lado, y ahora gracias a toda la experiencia que tiene sus productos son reconocidos por tener muy buena calidad. La mayor dificultad que ha tenido en su negocio es que al aspirar diariamente el humo del fogón, presenta algunas dificultades de salud y a veces debe dejar de trabajar durante unas horas. Debido a que en la temporada de invierno el conseguir madera buena y a un buen precio es tan difícil, Rosbeny busca un préstamo para comprar madera de buena calidad y poder acceder a los altos precios que hay en temporada de invierno.

Su mayor sueño es sacar este negocio adelante para que su hijo pueda tener una educación universitaria que le permita progresar. Además, sueña con que su familia tenga la oportunidad de tener mejor calidad de vida y mayores oportunidades económicas para salir adelante.
texts.en:
Rosbeny has an arepa [grilled corncakes] factory that’s a family tradition and that generates income to contribute economically to her home and to move her 18-year-old son forward.  She learned this activity while very young thanks to her parents’ teaching her so that she could work with them.  Now, thanks to all the experience she has all her products are known for being of very good quality.

The greatest difficulty she's had in her business is inhaling the smoke from the stove every day which has caused her some health problems and sometimes she has to stop working for a few hours.  Because during the winter it’s difficult to get good quality firewood at a good price Rosbeny is looking for a loan to buy good quality firewood and be able to afford the high winter prices.

Her greatest dream is to move the business forward so that her son can attend university and be able to progress. She also dreams with her family having the opportunity of having a better quality of life and greater economic opportunities to get ahead.

loans.use: to buy good quality firewood

loans.name: Nélida Elcy

texts.es:
Nélida es una joven emprendedora de 22 años de edad que para poder acceder a sus estudios universitarios tiene su propio negocio de cría de ganado y pollos; actividad que aprendió de sus padres que se dedican a esta actividad y desde muy joven desarrollaba a su lado, hasta que un día decidió tener sus propios animales para poderse pagar sus estudios.
