Lilian is a dynamic single woman with three children, one of whom is younger than 15. She lives in the Mile 90, Bamenda, northwest region of Cameroon. She and her family live in a three-room apartment. Lilian works making dresses. She has faced many challenges in her life such as the lack of financing to start her business and a low income which makes it difficult to take care of basic needs. Lilian dropped out of school due to the lack of school fees and her mother's death further compounded the situation. She joined GHAPE in 2006 and has seen a light in the horizon due to resources such as cheap and affordable business financing, long loan repayment durations, and life skills and business and marketing training. 

Lilian is requesting a loan to buy thread and cloth to use in her dressmaking workshop. She will also use part of her loan to pay for farm labor and buy seedlings, manure, and fertilizer. Lilian thinks that her dress making business will succeed because of her longevity as a seamstress and high demand. Her business will help the community because dresses will be available at cheap prices. There will also be more food items on her farm. Lilian will use the profit from her loan to provide medical care for her family, pay school fees, and expand her dressmaking workshop.

loans.use: to buy thread and cloth to use in her dressmaking workshop

loans.name: Ouk

texts.en:
Ouk is 58 years old and has three school-aged children who currently attend local schools. He is a government officer who works in the ministry of tourism of Cambodia located in KamponTom province. Ouk has been in this occupation for many years and earns a decent salary to support his family. He is very happy because his wife helps him with the household income by operating a grocery store and serving breakfast, lunch, and dinner to local people. Ouk and his wife agreed to educate their children up to a university degree and they try hard to support their basic needs.

Ouk is requesting a 1,500 USD loan to purchase a motorcycle to serve as a transportation service for his children as their high schools are far away from home. His loan will support his children in their education so they can earn degrees in the future and have better jobs.

loans.use: to purchase a motorcycle​ so his children can commute to school

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is a married woman. She has 4 children with ages ranging from 10 years to 25 years. She describes herself to be faithful woman. She operates a retail stall where she sells sacks of charcoal. She has been involved in this business for 2 years. Her business is located at a strategic business area and her primary customers are esteemed business people. 

She describes her biggest business challenge to be the shortage of charcoal for resell. She will use the Kes 8700 loan to buy a water tank. Her business goal is to improve her business within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will have expanded her business. Previously, Susan had been selling clothes which she decided to stop doing and started engaging herself in her current charcoal selling activity. She had taken a loan of Kes 20,000 which she managed to repay.

loans.use: to buy a water tank.

loans.name: Tabitha

texts.en:
Tabitha, 28 years old, is married and has a daughter who is 4 years old. She describes herself as warm and friendly. For the past 3 years, Tabitha has operated a farm and a poultry business where she sells eggs, milk, vegetables such as kale, pumpkins and paw paw (papaya). Her business is located on a main road in Rongai and her primary customers are surrounding residents and shops at the market. Tabitha describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficients funds.

Tabitha will use the KES 32,700 loan to buy a water tank to catch rain water which can be used on the farm and for her chickens and cow. Her goal is to improve her business whereby the profit can be used to revive her matatu (bus) business within 5 years. Tabitha hopes that, in the future, she will have many businesses and her family will prosper. Tabitha also runs a beauty salon. She has three sisters who help with the farm, poultry and other businesses. Her whole family will benefit from the water tank.

loans.use: to buy a water tank.

loans.name: Hannah

texts.en:
Hannah, 38 years old, is married and has 4 children whose ages range from 1 to 14 years. She describes herself as jovial and warm. Hannah operates a poultry business and eight Posho mills, selling maize flour and eggs. She has been involved in this business for 2 years and employs 10 staff members with the help of her husband. Her business is located near the main road of Rongai and her primary customers are surrounding residents. Hannah describes her biggest business challenge to be the shortage of maize for grinding into flour.

Hannah will use this KES 32,700 loan to purchase a water tank that she will use for household chores and poultry. Her business goal is to build rental houses within 5 years. She hopes that, in the future, she will educate her children.

loans.use: to purchase a water tank

loans.name: Rorbert

texts.en:
Rorbert, 28 years old, is married and blessed with three children. For the past year, he has run a motorbike transport business, popularly known as boda boda, in Kabarnet, earning an average monthly income of KES 15,000. 

Rorbert has borrowed a second loan of KES 50,000, having successfully repaid his previous loan. He intends to use this loan to purchase a new motorbike after disposing of the one he currently operates. Rorbert anticipates getting profits which he will use to expand the business by purchasing more motorbikes and employing riders to assist him.

Rorbert hopes to improve his living standards, to save money to enable him to pay his children's school fees and to start another business for his spouse.

loans.use: To purchase a new motorbike

loans.name: Maoda Malick

texts.fr:
Mawdo Malick est un jeune de 22 ans qui est célibataire sans enfant. Il est mécanicien de profession ou il a acquis une expérience de 5 ans. Il a ouvert une place au marché de son quartier et vend des pièces détachées. C’est la raison pour laquelle il demande un crédit de 30000Fcfa qui est d’ailleurs son 1er prêt à l’IMCEC.
Il a comme charge sa maman, avec qui il vit. Il désire dans l’avenir agrandir son commerce en augmentant la capacité des produits et pièces détachées qu’il vend.
texts.en:
Mawdo Malick is a 22-year old man, single without children. He is a car mechanic by trade and has five years of experience. He has opened a stand at the local market where he sells spare parts. This is why he is requesting a loan of 30,000 West African francs, which is his first loan with IMCEC.
He supports his mother, who lives with him. In the future, he would like to expand his business by expanding the volume of products and spare parts for sale.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for resale.

loans.name: Rosa Mercedes

texts.es:
Rosa tiene 67 años, y tiene la alegría y el espíritu de una joven de 20 años; con esfuerzo ha criado y sacado adelante sola a sus 4 hijos. Su vivienda se ubica en la ciudad de Ica,  ciudad que se caracteriza por tener uno de los atractivos turísticos más importantes del país, el cual es la “Laguna de Huacachina”, asimismo otro de sus atractivos turísticos es la famosa “bruja de Cachiche”, la cual es visitada por infinidad de turistas en cualquier época del año.  Como buena peruana le gusta mucho la comida típica de nuestro país, por ello su platillo favorito es el riquísimo “Tallarín con papa a la Huancaína”; debido a los pocos recursos económicos de sus padres ella solo tuvo estudios secundarios, pero le hubiera gustado mucho estudiar para ser profesora.

Rosa se levanta muy temprano para abrir su negocio de venta de abarrotes, le dedica a su negocio alrededor de 10 horas y puede atender hasta 30 clientes en el día; ella cree que le va bien en su negocio porque vende productos de buena calidad y trata muy bien a los clientes y sobre todo a un buen precio.

Rosa está muy agradecida con los prestatarios kiva ya que le han brindado su apoyo por segunda vez y gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado ella podrá comprar una balanza electrónica, comprar repisas y mercadería como arroz, azúcar, fideos, entre otros, con lo cual podrá dar una mejor atención a su clientes y mejorar sus ingresos y su calidad de vida, lo que le permitirá seguir luchando día a día para poder realizar su más grande sueño:” Tener tienda Comercial”.
texts.en:
Rosa is 67 years old and has the happiness and spirit of a young woman of 20 years of age. With effort she has raised and brought her children forward by herself. Her home is located in the city of Ica. The city is characterized for having one of the most attractive tourist sites in the country, the "Laguna de Huacachina". Another one of its attractive tourist sites is the famous "Bruja de Cachiche" which is visited by an infinite number of tourists during anytime of the year. Like a good Peruvian she likes the typical food of the country and her favorite dish is the delicious "Tallarin con papa a la Huancaina". Due to her parents' limited economic resources she only went up to secondary school but would have liked to study to become a teacher. 

Rosa gets up very early to open her grocery store. She dedicates about 10 hours to her store and can attend to up to 30 customers during the day. She believes that it is going well for her in her business because she sells good quality products and treats her customers very well. Above all everything is at a good price. 

Rosa is very thankful for the Kiva lenders that are now bringing her support for the second time. Thanks to the help provided she will be able to buy an electronic scale, shelves and goods such as rice, sugar and noodles, among other items. With these she will be able to give her customers better service and improve her earnings and standard of living. This will allow her to continue fighting each day to fulfill her greatest dream: to have her own larger store.

loans.use: to buy a scale, display cases and merchandise.

loans.name: Raqia

texts.en:
Ms. Raqia is a 33-year-old married woman who's been selling milk for the past 20 years. She has five calves and two milk cows. She sells milk to many of her neighbors, along with butter that she makes from the milk. Her business is good enough for her to lead a decent life. She has two daughters who are going to school. She is very motivated to provide them with a beautiful life including good education, food and clothing. She has improved her business to meet the day-to-day expenses of life. 

It’s Ms. Raqia's second year with Kashf Foundation, and she is happily running her business with its support. Now she has requested a loan of 30,000 Pakistani rupees to purchase one more cow and feed for its calves. She hopes to increase her production capacity which ultimately helps to generate more cash.

loans.use: to purchase one more cow and feed for its calves.

loans.name: Milcah

texts.en:
Milcah is a 32 year old married woman. She has 2 children with ages ranging from 5 years to 7 years. She describes herself to be honest and faithful woman. She operates a retail stall where she sells clothes . She has been involved in this business for 5 years. Her business is located at a very strategic market area and her primary customers are daily customers. 

She describes her biggest business challenge to be weather changes leading to varying purchasing power from the customers. Her business goal is to run a profit-oriented big boutique within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will be independent and a lender to other customers. Milcah has a motorcycle and she has employed a person who helps daily in providing transportation to residents. 

She will use the Kes 21,000 loan to purchase a water tank for home use. This is her second loan.

loans.use: to buy a water tank.

loans.name: Naseem

texts.en:
Ms. Naseem is a 40-year-old married women. She has been in carpet manufacturing for the past 12 years. She offers various handmade carpets and is famous in her circle for providing good quality products. She is happily doing it for the sake of her family.

Ms. Naseem is the mother of five daughters and two sons. She is trying hard to fulfill their demands including food, health, clothing and education. She is also doing sewing work as her part-time job. In this way, she is able to meet her family's needs and requirements effectively. It’s her third year with Kashf Foundation. She is satisfied with the support of Kashf Foundation and applied for a loan of 10,000 Pakistani rupees to buy additional raw materials including wool, frames, etc., to better support her family.

loans.use: to buy additional raw materials including wool, frames, etc.

loans.name: Salman

texts.en: Salman is a 24 year old university student. He lives in Mafraq with his large family. He has 9 brothers and sisters. Being a responsible, reasonable person, Ashraf knows it is hard for his parents to pay for his university expenses. And therefore he wishes to get the loan so he can pay for his university expenses and get his bachelor's degree.

loans.use: to pay for his university expenses.

loans.name: Paula Katty

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Progreso Del Mar se reúne cada 15 días en el hermoso balneario de San Mateo en la ciudad de  Manta, conocido por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año por turistas nacionales y extranjeros, en  este lugar la mayoría de los habitantes se dedica a la pesca y a las faenas del mar.

En este lugar vive la señora Paula, tiene 50 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen cinco hijos, cuatro de ellos ya mayores de edad y el menor tiene 15 años, tres de ellos aun viven en su casa, dos estudian en universidad y el menor en colegio. Su esposo se dedica a la pesca pero actualmente está enfermo y no trabaja.

Ella para ganar algo por su cuenta y con esto ayudar a su esposo a cubrir los gastos de la casa, se dedica a la venta de ropa de todo tipo, su forma de venta es puerta a puerta y también vende en su casa donde tiene unas vitrinas para ofrecer sus productos, ella sale a recorrer cuatro  días a la semana y los fines de semana vende en su local,  vende al contado o deja a crédito a sus clientes más conocidos. Tiene tres años que se dedica a esta actividad y le va muy bien, ella empezó con el primer crédito que recibió de la institución.

Está repitiendo el crédito ya que le fue muy bien en su negocio sobretodo en los días de inicio de clases que vendió mucho, sus ganancias fueron muy buenas y que le sirvieron para los estudios de sus hijos ya que tuvo muchos gastos pero gracias al crédito pudo solventar. Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar ropa en general pero sobretodo uniformes y ropa interior para niños. Está en el Banco Comunal desde hace tres años  y le gusta por la ayuda que le brindan los créditos. 

Su sueño es que su esposo mejore y vuelva a sus faenas del mar ya que es muy difícil solventar los gastos ella sola.
texts.en:
The members of the “Progreso Del Mar” (Progress of the Sea) communal bank meet every two weeks in the beautiful San Mateo spa in the city of Manta, known for its beautiful beaches which are visited by national and foreign tourists year round. Most of the people here fish or perform other labors of the sea.

Here we meet Paula. She’s 50 years old, married and as a result has four adult children and one 14 year old. Three of them still live at home, two attend university, and the youngest is in school. Her husband is a fisherman, but he’s ill and not currently working. 

In order to be able to earn some money on her own and help her husband with the household expenses, Paula sells all types of clothing door to door and also out of her home, where she has some display cases to offer her products. She goes out to sell four days a week and on the weekends she sells from her stall where the tourists visit. She sells for cash or offers credit to her best customers and collects every week. She buys her merchandise in Guayaquil based on what she needs. She’s been doing this for three years and things are going well. 

Paula started with the money from the first loan she got through the institution. She will use the money from this loan to buy clothing, especially children’s uniforms and undergarments. She’s been a part of the communal bank for three years,  and she enjoys it because it provides loans. She hopes that her husband will get well and that he is able to return to his labors of the sea. It’s difficult for her to pay all the expenses herself.

loans.use: to buy uniforms, undergarments for children, and other clothing.

loans.name: Tork

texts.en:
Rice farming is the primary source of income for Tork’s family. She has been managing a farming business for over 20 years, and she is now 42 years of age. Her focus crops are rice, beans, potatoes and vegetables. Tork is married to a humble man and has four children who are still attending school and need daily allowances.

Tork wants to improve her income so she is now asking for a loan of $750 US to buy rice and bean seeds and potato plants for growing on her farmland. This will enable her to obtain good crop production at harvesting season and; thereby, increase her income to cover her daily needs. Someday, Tork hopes to become a successful entrepreneur in growing her crops.

loans.use: to buy rice and bean seeds and potato plants for growing on her farmland.

loans.name: Bun

texts.en:
Bun is 36 years old and a resident living in Ornlong Veng district with her spouse and five children, all of whom are still attending school. They help her cultivate rice when they have no schedule at school. Bun is a proud and industrious farmer in her community. With great help from her husband and children, Bun can ensure healthy crops each harvesting season. Even so, she is ambitious about developing her business and pursuing a better standard of living. Bun aims to provide a higher education for all of her children.

Bun is in need of additional capital to grow her business, so she is asking for a loan of 2,000,000 riels to buy seeds, pesticides and fertilizers. Hopefully this time she can get better income than in previous years, so that she can save for the future of her family as well as for her children’s education.

loans.use: to buy seeds, pesticides and fertilizers.

loans.name: Lina Eulalia

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Virgen Del Mar se reúne cada 15 días en el hermoso balneario de San Mateo en la ciudad de Manta, conocido por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año por turistas nacionales y extranjeros, en  este lugar la mayoría de los habitantes se dedica a la pesca y a las faenas del mar.

En este lugar vive la señora Lina, tiene 50 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tiene cinco hijos todos mayores de edad, uno de ellos aun vive en su casa. Su esposo se dedica a la pesca.

Ella para ganar algo por su cuenta y con esto ayudar con los gastos del hogar se dedica a la venta de ropa de todo tipo, su forma de venta es puerta a puerta y también vende en su  casa hasta donde llegan sus clientes. Trabaja todos los días,  deja a crédito a sus clientes  y cobra en dos partes. Su mercadería  la compra en Manta o en  Guayaquil cuando puede. Tiene cuatro años que se dedica a esta actividad y le va muy bien.

Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar más mercadería como: pantalones, blusas, camisetas y ropa de niños. Está en el Banco Comunal desde hace 4 años y le gusta porque gracias al primer crédito empezó su negocio. 

Su sueño es seguir adelante con su negocio.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Virgen Del Mar" gets together every two weeks in the gorgeous beach resort of San Mateo in the city of Manta, known for it's beautiful beaches that are visited all year round by foreign and domestic tourists.  Here, the majority of locals make a living in fishing and other sea industries.  

This is where Lina lives.  She is 50 years old, married and has five adult children.  One of them lives in her home.  Her husband makes a living in the fishing industry. 

In order to carry her weight and help with expenses she makes a living selling all kinds of clothing.  Her selling style is door to door and also sells from her home to customers who visit.  She works every day, gives her customers credit, and charges in two installments.  She purchases her merchandise in Manta or in Guayaquil when she gets a chance.  She has been doing this for four years and it is going really well for her.  

She will use this loan to purchase more merchandise like: pants, blouses, t-shirts, and children's clothing.  She has been part of this communal bank for four years and she likes it because, thanks to her first loan, she started her business.  

Her dream is to grow her business.

loans.use: to purchase pants, blouses, t-shirts, and children's clothing.

loans.name: El Eden Group

texts.es: Buenas tardes desde Perú, les presento al grupo comunal  “El Eden”, grupo formado por 9 socios todos ellos caracterizados por su solidaridad y deseos de salir adelante. La Sra. Vilma de 75 años de edad es viuda y madre de dos hijos. Ella se dedica diariamente a la confección de prendas de vestir y en menor medida a costuras de reparación. El préstamo lo invertirá en la compra de una máquina de coser con la cual podrá agilizar sus trabajos y generar mayores ingresos para su hogar. Ella es una mujer luchadora y emprendedora que no se da por vencida; asimismo, agradece a todas las personas que a través de Kiva y Edaprospo la ayudan a  cumplir sus metas porque sabe que lo hacen de buena voluntad.
texts.en:
Greetings from Peru!  Introducing the communal bank "El Eden" which consists of nine members who are all characterized by their solidarity and desire to succeed.  

Vilma is 75 years old, widowed, and the mother of two children.  She works everyday in garment making as well as some tailoring.  She will invest the loan in the purchase of a sewing machine which will allow her to speed up her work and generate better income for her household.  

Vilma is an enterprising woman and a born fighter that will not give up.  Likewise, she is thankful to all the people within Kiva and Edaprospo that are helping her achieve her goals as she knows they do it through good will.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine.

loans.name: Enhtuya

texts.en:
Enhtuya, age 47, lives with her husband and two children in an apartment in Arhangai province. She has been managing her organic dairy products trading business for 6 years. Currently, she is renting a rental counter at a food market in the center of Arhangai province. She has many regular suppliers and buyers.  Her husband helps with her business. Her two children are students.  

Enhtuya is requesting 1,000,000 MNT to purchase organic curd, organic dried curd, and organic sour milk from the countryside because the dairy season of Mongolia is coming.  Enhtuya is a friendly and brave woman who says, "When my business expands in the next few years, I will build a private house for my family."

loans.use: buy curds and milk to sell

loans.name: Tsend-Ayush

texts.en:
Tsend-Ayush is 43 years old.  She lives with her husband and three children.  Tsend-Ayush started a shoe production and retail business 3 years ago. She goes to the country-side to sell her products.  Because she has made and sold these products for 3 years, she now has many customers. 

Tsend-Ayush is requesting a 3,000,000 MNT loan to import more raw materials for shoes from China because her product demand has increased and is very high now.  If she can make this big order, her working capital will be improved and it will help expanded her business. Her youngest son is sick. With the expanded business and increased income, she does not need to worry her youngest son's treatment fees.

loans.use: buy shoe materials

loans.name: Randy

texts.en:
Randy is 21 years old.  He is single and does not support any person in the family.  He has been in the hardware business for two years and currently earns a monthly income of KES 15,000.

This is his second loan with KADET.  He has successfully repaid the first loan. This loan will be used to buy stock such as tools and pipes for his business.The anticipated profits will be used to diversify his business.  His dreams and hopes are to open other hardware branches outside Kamulu.

loans.use: buy hardware items to sell

loans.name: Francis

texts.en:
Francis is 35 years old.  He is married to Agnes and they have one child, aged two years old.

Francis has been in the transport and farming business for two years and earns a monthly income of KES 20,000.  This is his second loan from KADET.  He has successfully paid back the first loan.  This loan will be used to service his motorbike and buy seedlings for planting.  The anticipated profits will be used to expand his current business and also diversify his businesses.  His hopes and dreams are to own a chain of boda bodas and also to expand his farming to large scale.

loans.use: to service his motorbike and buy seedlings for planting

loans.name: Esmeralda

texts.en: Esmeralda is a 52-year-old widow from the community of Sikatuna, Bohol. For eleven years now she has been engaged in a sari-sari store business and a business raising hogs. She is asking for a loan to buy more merchandise such as canned goods, biscuits, seasonings, and also piglets and feed. She is hoping that she can improve her business so she can better provide for her needs now that she is older. She hopes to have an increased profit for her future needs so she can retire in comfort.

loans.use: restock her store and buy piglets and feed

loans.name: Diega

texts.en:
Diega is a 62-year-old  woman from Bohol, Philippines. She has been in the hog raising business for many years now. This is her only source of income. 

Diega is in need of additional capital for her business. She is asking for a loan worth 20000 PHP to buy feed and medicine for her pigs and to expand her pigpen. With this she will be able to expand her business and augment her income. 

Diega dreams of making her business a successful one. She believes that if she is provided with financial support such as this loan, she can finally realize her dream of making her business a productive one.

loans.use: buy pig feed and medicine and expand her pigpen

loans.name: Librada

texts.en:
Librada may be 78 years old, but she is more energetic than her real age. She is married to a farmer and they live in Sikatuna, Bohol. 

She is active in her business of selling fresh meat (pork and beef) in the wet market of the towns Albur and Sikatuna. She usually spends her days in these places during market day to sell meat. She is asking for a loan of 22,000 PHP to buy more meat from the suppliers so she can earn a better profit. 

She is happy to work and for her this is a form of exercise and good for her health. She hopes to continue doing business so she can buy nutritious food for herself and her husband.

loans.use: to buy meat from her suppliers.

loans.name: Chimbonja

texts.en:
Chimboja lives in the Mombasa area of Coast province, Kenya. He is married and has five children. He owns a charcoal business, which he has been operating for ten years now.

He learned about Milango through a friend who invited him to the group, and he joined with an aim of accessing credit to improve on his business operations. His main challenge is low markets due to the seasonal market.

Chimboja is applying for a loan of 62,650 Kenya shillings to purchase additional stock of charcoal. His extra income will be added to his savings to pay school fees for his children. 

He aspires to expand and start a transport business and build a rental house.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock of charcoal.

loans.name: Rita

texts.en:
Rita is 44 years old and from Bil-isan, Panglao, Bohol. She is married with three adult children. Her husband is a fisherman and Rita sells whatever he catches from fishing. She also buys more fish from other fishermen that she resells in the neighborhood. 

She is asking for a loan to buy fish, fishing net, and gasoline for their fishing business. Rita enjoys what she is doing and she is always optimistic on what the future holds for her and her family. 

She hopes to expand their fishing business someday and to have more fishing boats for a better income.

loans.use: to buy fish, fishing net, and gasoline.

loans.name: Lourdes Teresa

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Progreso Del Mar  se reúne cada 15 días en el hermoso balneario de San Mateo en la ciudad de Manta, conocido por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año por turistas nacionales y extranjeros, en  este lugar la mayoría de los habitantes se dedica a la pesca y a las faenas del mar.

En este lugar vive la señora Lourdes, tiene 63 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tuvo 7 hijos pero 4 de ellos fallecieron. Los  tres que tiene ya son mayores de edad e independientes. Su esposo trabaja ocasionalmente ya que es mayor de edad.

Ella hace varios años aprendió corte y confección en una academia en la localidad y hoy junto a su hija tienen un pequeño taller de costura en su casa, se dedican a confeccionar todo tipo de ropa, aunque lo que más le gusta elaborar es ropa de mujer o de niñas, también cosen ropa para ciertos bazares en la ciudad de Manta los cuales les piden sus prendas para luego vender en sus locales, también confeccionan sabanas las mismas que también entregan a estos lugares o que ellas mismas se encarga de vender y les dejan muy buenas ganancias, llevan más de 15 años con su taller y casi nunca les falta el trabajo.

Este nuevo crédito lo va utilizar en comprar telas, hilos, botones  y otros materiales para la costura.  Esta desde el inicio en el banco comunal y le gusta todo del banco. 

Su sueño es tener un taller más grande y con operarias.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank Progreso del Mar (Sea Progress) meets every 15 days in the beautiful San Mateo swimming area in the city of Manta which is known for its beautiful beaches which have tourists all year from within the country and abroad.  In this place the majority of residents work fishing and in the sea.

Lourdes lives here, she is 63-years-old, married, and had seven children with her husband, but four of them died.  The three that she still has are independent adults.  Her husband works occasionally as he is now older.

Several years ago she learned to cut and make clothing in a local school and now she works with her daughter in a small sewing workshop in her house.  They work making all kinds of clothing, although they like most to make clothing for women and girls.  They also sew clothing for certain markets in Manta which order garments to then sell in their shops.  They also make sheets which she also delivers to these shops or which they sell themselves which gives them very good profits.  They have had their workshop for more than 15 years and almost never lack work.

They will use this new loan to buy fabrics, threads, buttons, and other materials for sewing.  She has been with this communal bank from the beginning and likes everything about it. 

Her dream is to have a bigger workshop with employees.

loans.use: to buy fabrics, threads, buttons, and other sewing materials.

loans.name: Zoila Obdulia

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Virgen Del Mar se reúne cada 15 días en el hermoso balneario de San Mateo en la ciudad de  Manta, conocido por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año por turistas nacionales y extranjeros, en  este lugar la mayoría de los habitantes se dedica a la pesca y a las faenas del mar.

En este lugar vive la señora Zoila, tiene 32 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen dos hijos de 11 y 9 años de edad, los dos estudian en escuela Su esposo se dedica a la pesca.

Ella tiene un negocio de venta de materiales de pesca como por ejemplo redes, anzuelos, piolas, plomos, arpones,  entre  otras muchas cosas que se requieren para realizar una buena pesca en alta mar, trabaja tres días a la semana, ella ofrece sus productos a los pescadores una vez que llegan de alta mar, cada quince días viaja hasta el centro de Manta a comprar lo necesario para que cuando lleguen sus clientes tener de todo para ellos, lleva más de 4 años en esta actividad y le va muy bien ya que tiene muchos clientes.

Este crédito es para comprar redes, piolas, anzuelos, grapas, entre otros productos. Está en el Banco Comunal desde hace 4 años y medio  y le gusta porque con el primer crédito empezó este negocio.
 
Su sueño es comprar una lancha para la pesca.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank Virgen del Mar (Our Lady of the Sea) meets every 15 days in the beautiful San Mateo swimming area in the city of Manta which is known for its beautiful beaches which have tourists all year from within the country and abroad.  In this place the majority of residents work fishing and in the sea.

Zoila lives there, she is 32-years-old, married, and has two children who are 11 and nine-years-old and are in school.  Her husband is a fisherman.

She has a business selling fishing supplies like nets, hooks, line, weights, harpoons, and many other things needed to fish well in the deep sea.  She works three days a week and sells her products to the fishermen when they come in from the ocean.  Every 15 days she travels to the center of Manta to buy what she needs so that she has everything for her customers when they arrive.  She has been in this business for more than four years and it is going very well as now she has many customers.

This loan is to buy nets, line, hooks, lures, and other products.  She has been in the communal bank for four and a half years and likes it because she used her first loan to start this business.

Her dream is to buy a fishing boat.

loans.use: to buy nets, line, hooks, lures, etc.

loans.name: Anesia

texts.en:
Anesia is 43 years old, married and has four children. Her eldest is 17 and her youngest is 2 years old.
 
Anesia has been in the business of raising hogs, which she started 3 years ago. She plans to use her loan to buy feed, piglets and supplements. This will help her hogs to grow healthy and will assure that she will be in business for a long time. 

In the future, Anesia would like to make a bigger barn to accommodate more pigs and give her children a better future.

loans.use: buy feed, piglets and supplements

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
Judith lives in the Mombasa area of Coast province, Kenya. She is married and has three children. She has a juice vending business, a business she has been operating for five years now.  

Judith learned about Milango through a friend who invited her to the group and she joined with an aim of accessing credit to improve on her business operations. Her main challenge is the seasonal weather.

Judith is applying a loan of 31,450 Kenyan shillings to buy fruits wholesale.   Her extra income will be used to pay school fees for her children.  She aspires to expand her business to a bigger one than the one she has.

loans.use: buy fruits wholesale

loans.name: Agripina

texts.en:
Agripina is a 49-year-old married woman and mother of two grown-up children from Bohol, Philippines. She is engaged in a farming business and a sari-sari (convenience store) business for more than 14 years now. She helps her husband in tilling the farm while they grow rice on it. These businesses provide them the income that they need for their expenses and sustainability.
 
Agripina is asking for a loan worth 20,000 PHP since she needs to buy additional fertilizer for her rice field. Moreover, she wants to purchase more merchandise to sell in her store. With this, she will be able to have a good quality harvest thus improving her yield in her farm, and for her store she can cater to more customers since she has more items to sell to them.
 
Agripina hopes of making her business a success. She believes that the loan will help her in making her dreams of improving their livelihood come true. She wants to experience the fullness of life together with her family.

loans.use: buy fertilizer for her farm and restock her store

loans.name: Emrije

texts.en:
Emrije is forty-five, married and has three teenage children, one of her children suffer from severe autism. They live in the northeast part of the country,  which is characterized by the extreme cold temperatures that affect animals, just like it affects people. This is the reason that Emrije is requesting a loan to build a stable for her animals and this needs to be built just before winter kicks in, starting in the very beginning of October. This is not her first loan, and the previous one has been repaid on time.

For the past ten years, Emrije has been operating a livestock business and has been the only financial provider for her family ever since. Her husband has been helping her as well with the business. “If there is any extra moneys, I would invest it on my children’s education,” she said, “yet, the extra expenses on my sick child and the fact that I am the sole financial  provider, doesn’t allow me to save any pennies” she continues saying with her eyes full of tears.

Emrije is extremely thankful to potential Kiva lenders for their understanding.

loans.use: build a stable

loans.name: Concordia

texts.en:
Concordia is 41 years old, married and and has three teenage children. They live in Sikatuna, Bohol. She sells dried fish and also farms rice for a living and has been doing this for 10 years now. 

Concordia is asking for a loan to buy more supplies of dried fish and plastic bags, and to pay for the transportation of the dried fish and fertilizer to her farm. The loan will greatly help Concordia in sustaining and improving her businesses for the sake of her family. In the future, she plans to make the best out of her profit by expanding her business to increase profitability.

loans.use: buy fertilizer and dried fish

loans.name: Luisa

texts.en:
Luisa is a 49-year-old married woman with seven children. She lives in Bohol, Philippines, together with her family. Luisa has been in the sari-sari store or mini-grocery business for more than 25 years now. She sells snack foods, canned goods, noodles, sodas and other items to the people in her community and to passers-by. This business provides her the income that she needs.

Luisa works hard to support her husband in meeting the needs of their family. As of this time, she needs additional capital for her business. She is requesting for a loan worth 15000 PHP to buy additional merchandise to sell, like canned goods, sodas, and other snack foods. With this, she will be able to cater to and attract more customers, thus increasing her sales and income. In the future, Luisa wants to expand her business to generate more income for their sustenance.

loans.use: restock her store

loans.name: Editha

texts.en:
Editha is 50 years old and has two children, ages 10 and 14. They live in Loon, Bohol. 

Editha has been in the business of raising hogs for five years now. She plans to use her loan to buy feed, piglets and supplements for her hogs. She is determined to make a success of her business, and the loan will really help her to produce fattened hogs that are easy to market and be profitable. 

In the future, Editha would like to increase her hogs and improve her barn to better provide her children with what they need.

loans.use: buy feed, piglets and supplements

loans.name: Milagros

texts.en:
Milagros is a 46-year-old woman from the community of Panglao, Bohol. She is married and has five children. Her eldest is 21 and her youngest is 10 years old. 

Milagros has been in the business of raising hogs for 3 years now. She plans to use her loan to buy piglets, feed and supplements for her hogs. Her hogs are precious to her, giving her the chance to earn an income and be of help in meeting the needs of her family.   By earning income, she has become a better spouse to her husband, who is a painter and a habal-habal (motorcycle used to transport passengers) driver. 

In the future, Milagros plans to build a bigger barn and raise a sow so she can earn a better income for her family.

loans.use: buy piglets, feed and supplements

loans.name: Abita

texts.en:
Abita is a 55-year-old married woman and a mother of two grown up children. She lives in Bohol, Philippines together with her family. Abita has been in the fish vending business for more than 20 years now. This is the only source of her income.

Abita works hard to support her family, however, she lacks the capital for her business to grow and become sustainable. She is asking for a loan worth 4,000 PHP to buy more fish to sell and a bucket for their storage. With this, she will be able to enhance her sales and profit.

In the future, Abita hopes of expanding her business to generate more income and improve her way of living. She also plans to save some of her earnings for future use.

loans.use: buy fish and a storage bucket

loans.name: Juan Elias

texts.es:
Juan es un  joven de 18 años, vive con sus padres y hermanos en la ciudad de Chincha, a pesar de ser tan joven él es muy trabajador, entusiasta, con un gran deseo de superación; lamentablemente por la necesidad de trabajar y ayudar a sus padres a solventar sus gastos aun no ha podido estudiar una carrera superior, pero sueña con poder hacerlo, en sus ratos libres le gusta relajarse escuchando un poco de música y en algunas ocasiones cocina una riquísima Carapulcra con sopa seca para compartir con su familia.
Con mucho empeño y entusiasmo, día a día Juan trabaja como obrero en una empresa textil de su ciudad, él labora un aproximado de 12 horas diarias en turnos rotativos, a veces puede trabajar de noche y en otras ocasiones de día, él se siente a gusto realizando su labor y sus jefes lo consideran mucho por su buen desempeño y por su trato amable.
Juan se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar el mejoramiento de su vivienda, él desea poder techar y realizar el cercado de su vivienda; de esta manera Juan espera poder brindar mayor seguridad y bienestar a su familia, y así el espera poder seguir esforzándose y ayudando a su familia a salir adelante.
texts.en:
Juan is a young man of 18. He lives with his parents and siblings in the city of Chincha. Despite being so young, he is very hard-working and enthusiastic, with a great desire for self-improvement. 

Unfortunately, because of the need to work and help his parents to meet their expenses, he has still not been able to pursue post-secondary education. But he dreams of being able to do so. In his free time he likes to relax by listening to a little music, and sometimes he cooks a very delicious "carapulcra con sopa seca" (traditional Peruvian dish made with noodles and dried potatoes), to share with his family. 

With a great deal of effort and enthusiasm, Juan works day to day in a textile company in his city. He works approximately 12 hours daily in shifts.  Sometimes he may work at night, and at other times during the day. He feels happy doing his work, and his supervisors think highly of him for his good performance and his friendliness.

Juan is very grateful to the Kiva lenders, as thanks to the help provided, he will be able to undertake home improvements. He wishes to do roofing and fencing at his home. This way Juan hopes to be able to offer greater security and well-being to his family. He hopes to continue doing his very best and helping his family to get ahead in life.

loans.use: To pay for home improvements.

loans.name: Anecita

texts.en:
Anecita is a 52-year-old married woman from Bohol, Philippines. She has been in the food vending business for more than 6 years now. She bakes bread and sells it to the people in the neighborhood. This is her source of income.
Anecita is applying for a loan worth 6,000 PHP to buy additional ingredients for her bread making business such as flour, yeast, and sugar among others. With the loan, she will be able to bake more bread since she has the materials and ingredients needed for her to bake.
Anecita dreams of expanding her business in the future so that it will generate more income necessary for their daily needs and sustenance.

loans.use: to buy additional ingredients for her bread making business

loans.name: Nerriza

texts.en:
Nerriza is 45 years old and has a fish selling business. This business has been running for five years.
Nerriza has six children, the oldest is 27 and the youngest is 4 years old. She earns barely enough to meet the needs of her family, sometimes less. She works hard so she can support them and give them a better future. 

Nerriza has requested this loan to buy more fish to sell in her community. This way, she can also help the fishermen in her place. In the future, she would like to have a better location and stall where she can sell her fish. Her income will be for her family's daily consumption.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell

loans.name: Jackson

texts.en:
Jackson lives in Mombasa area of Coast province, Kenya. He is married and has three children. He owns a clothing shop, a business he has been operating for 10 years now.

He learned about Milango through a friend who invited him to the group and he joined with an aim of accessing credit to improve on his business operations. His main challenge is low markets due to seasonal markets. Jackson is applying for a loan of 73,050 Kenya shillings to purchase additional stocks of clothes. His extra income will be added to his savings to pay school fees for his children. He aspires to expand and buy a plot of land and build a rental house.

loans.use: To purchase additional stocks of clothes.

loans.name: Nzaro

texts.en:
Nzaro lives in Mariakani area of Coast Province, Kenya. He is married and has five children. He owns a retail shop, a business that he has been operating for ten years. He started the business through his personal savings.

He learned about Milango through friends who invited him to the group and he joined the group with the aim of accessing credit to improve his business operations. His main challenges are customers not paying on time and high fuel and high transport costs.

Nzaro is applying for a loan of 15,850 Kenya shillings to renovate the shop. His extra income from the loan will be added to his savings. His future plan is to open a wholesale shop.

loans.use: To renovate the shop.

loans.name: Eneria

texts.en:
Eneria is 34 years old. She is married with three children. Her oldest is 7 years old and the youngest is a 7-month-old baby. Eneria's husband works as a refrigerator and airconditioning technician. She helps by buying and selling powder soap as well as managing the purchase of orders of spare parts, tools and other equipment used by her husband as a technician. This business has been running for 7 years. The loan will be used to buy to buy pliers, screwdrivers and powder soap. She hopes that by providing her husband with what he needs, he can always be productive and bring a better income for their family.  

In the future, Eneria would like to expand on her business buying and selling of powder soap to include other household items for a better income.

loans.use: to buy pliers, screwdrivers and powder soap

loans.name: Claris

texts.en:
Claris lives in the Mariakani area of Coast province, Kenya. She is married and has seven children; six of whom are in school. She owns a retail shop, which she has been operating for ten years. She started the business through "merry-go-round" contributions*** and her brother’s savings.
She learnt about Milango through a friend with an aim of accessing credit to improve the business operations. The challenge she is facing is high transport cost and seasonal weather fluctuations.
Claris is applying for a loan of 41,900 Kenya shillings to buy sugar, maize flour and cereals wholesale. The extra income from the loan will be added to her savings to lift her living standard and for personal use. Her plan for the future is to sell wholesale.

***merry-go-round finance example: http://www.irinnews.org/Report/88795/KENYA-Merry-go-round-micro-finance-keeps-slum-residents-fed

loans.use: To buy sugar, maize flour and cereals wholesale.

loans.name: Juma

texts.en:
Juma lives in Kongowea area of Coast province, Kenya. He is single. He owns a transport business, a business he has been operating for three years.
He learnt about Milango through a friend who invited him and he joined a group with an aim of accessing credit to improve the business operations. The challenge he is facing is insufficient finances.
Juma is applying for a loan of 52,250 Kenya shillings to buy another motorbike. The extra income from the loan will be added to his savings to improve his living standard. His plan for the future is to buy many other motorbikes and expand the business.

loans.use: To buy another motorbike.

loans.name: Rosa Esilda

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Virgen Del Mar  se reúne cada 15 días en el hermoso balneario de San Mateo en la ciudad de  Manta, conocido por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año por turistas nacionales y extranjeros, en  este lugar la mayoría de los habitantes se dedica a la pesca y a las faenas del mar.

En este lugar vive la señora Rosa, ella tiene 57 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen cuatro hijos todos ellos  mayores de edad e independientes. Su esposo trabaja en una gasolinera de la localidad.

Ella tiene una tienda en su casa, allí vende productos como arroz, azúcar, aceites, detergentes, entre otras cosas, a pesar de que su tienda es pequeña sus clientes consiguen de todo, ese es el éxito para que sus clientes no se vayan a comprar en otras tiendas. Trabaja todos los días desde las 6h00 hasta las 20h00 y a veces hasta más tarde, ella se entretiene con sus amistades y conocidos que llegan todos los días  hasta su local, tiene su negocio 10 años y  le va muy bien.

Este crédito lo va a emplear en surtir mas su tienda, va a comprar arroz, azúcar, aceite, detergentes, entre otros productos. Es fundadora del  Banco Comunal hace más de 15 años y le gusta porque ha recibido mucha ayuda del banco.
 
Sus metas son seguir adelante en su negocio y que su tienda crezca cada día más.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank Virgen del Mar (Our Lady of the Sea) meets every 15 days in the beautiful San Mateo swimming area in the city of Manta which is known for its beautiful beaches which have tourists all year from within the country and abroad.  In this place the majority of residents work fishing and in the sea.

Rosa lives here, she is 57-years-old, married, and has four children with her husband.  All of her children are independent adults.  Her husband works in a gas station in the area.

She has a store in her house where she sells products like rice, sugar, oils, detergents, and other things.  Although her store is small, her customers find everything they need.  This is a success so that her customers don't go to buy in other stores.  She works every day from six in the morning to four in the afternoon and sometime later.  She entertains herself with her friends and acquaintances that come to her store every day.  She has had her business for ten years and it is going very well.

This loan will be used to stock her store.  She will buy rice, sugar, oil, detergents, and other products.  She founded the communal bank more than fifteen years ago and likes it because she has received a lot of help from the bank.  

Her goals are to continue moving forward with her business and for her store to grow more each day.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, oil, detergents, etc.

loans.name: Florencia

texts.en:
Florencia is a 58-year-old married woman with four grow children from Bohol, Philippines. Florencia has been engaged in a hog-raising business and motorcycle business for more than 10 years now. Her husband uses the motorcycle in transporting passengers from one place to another. 

Florencia is asking for a loan worth 6,000 PHP for the maintenance of the motorcycle and to buy feed for the pigs that she is raising. With this, she will be able to augment their income.

Florencia dreams of expanding her business to generate more income for their needs, like food consumption and others. Any additional income will be used for reinvestment into the same business and savings.

loans.use: maintain the motorcycle and to buy feed for the pigs

loans.name: Carmelita

texts.en:
Carmelita is from Poblacion, Panglao, Bohol. She is 56 years old, married with 9 children. Her eldest is 32 and her youngest is 14. Carmelita has a small business cooking snack foods which she sells in the community of Panglao. She cooks and sells pancakes and rice cakes for an income. 

She is asking for a loan to buy ingredients like sticky rice, flour, sugar and to pay for tuition fees of her children. She hopes to make a good profit out of this business so she can support her children's needs. Her profit will be for school fees and food for her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like sticky rice, flour, sugar and to pay for tuition fees

loans.name: Con Fe Y Alegria Group

texts.es:
¡Saludos desde Perú! Les presento el grupo Con Fe y Alegría

Gloria se dedica a la venta de verduras, tiene un puesto en un mercado de la zona donde vive, a este trabajo le dedica todos los días.Ella se levanta muy temprano para ir en busca de productos frescos que venderá diariamente, sus clientas son asiduas a su negocio por que les brinda productos frescos y de buena calidad, ya son 12 años que se dedica a su trabajo y gracias a esto puede mantener su hogar y darle a su hija una vida comoda.Gloria sueña con tener un puesto propio para no tener que pagar alquiler, así permitirle tener mejores ingresos; en esta oportunidad utilizara su préstamo para comprar más verduras y mejorar su negocio, esta agradecida a los inversionistas que la ayudaran a cumplir su sueño de seguir prosperando.


* Gloria viste chompa crema con marrón.
texts.en:
Hello from Peru!  Let me introduce you to the group Con Fe y Alegría (With Faith and Joy).

Gloria works selling vegetables, she has a stall in the market in the area where she lives.  She works there every day.  She gets up very early to go look for fresh products to sell daily.  She has very regular customers because she offers fresh, quality products.  She has now been working at this for 12 years and thanks to this can maintain her household and give her daughter a comfortable life.  Gloria's dream is to have her own stall so she doesn't have to pay rent, this will give her greater income.  She will use this loan to buy more vegetables and improve her business.  She is thankful to the investors that will help her to accomplish her dream to continue prospering.

*Gloria is wearing a cream and brown sweatshirt.

loans.use: to buy vegetables.

loans.name: Mujeres Virtuosas Group

texts.es:
Les presento a Gloria, la secretaria de la alcancía Mujeres Virtuosas. Ella es separada tiene 45 años y 02 hijos que aun estudian, debido a su separación; es ella sola quien solventa los gastos de la casa, así decidió empezar a trabajar con su primo que tenía un negocio de llantería, a pesar de ser un trabajo rudo ella lo desempeño de la mejor manera, con el tiempo su primo le dejo el negocio; poco a poco fue comprando sus propias herramientas hasta lograr tener un taller completo donde brinda servicio de enllantado, parches y venta de llantas de segunda. En la actualidad tiene un trabajador a su cargo que la ayuda con los trabajos pesados, su trabajo le ha permitido darle a sus hijos una vida cómoda y buenos estudios, el destino que le dará a su préstamo será comprar llantas y cámaras para así brindar un buen trabajo a toda su clientela. Gloria espera mejorar su negocio y  tener un taller más grande, esta agradecida por quienes permiten su préstamo tanto para ella como para todo su grupo.

* Gloria viste chompa naranja.
texts.en:
I present to you Gloria, secretary of the Mujeres Virtuosas ("Virtuous Women") communal bank. She is separated, 45 years old, and has two children who are in school. Due to her separation, she alone is responsible for household expenses. For this reason, she decided to start working with her cousin who had a tire repair business. Despite it being hard work, she performs it in the best way. With time, her cousin left her the business. Little by little, she was buying her own tools until she had a complete workshop where she offers tire service, patches, and second tires. Currently, she has an employee in her charge who helps her with the heavy labor. Gloria's work has allowed her to give her children a comfortable life and good schooling.

This loan's use will be to buy tires and tubes in order to offer good service to all of her customers. Gloria hopes to improve her business and to have a larger workshop. She is grateful to those who are allowing her this loan, both for herself and on behalf of her group.

* Gloria is pictured in the orange sweater.

loans.use: to buy tires and inner tubes.

loans.name: Praxedes

texts.en:
Praxedes is a 47-year-old married woman with seven children aged from 26 to five years old. They live in Bohol, Philippines. Praxedes has been operating her business for more than four years. She sells snack foods, candies, sodas and other dry goods to the people in their community.
 
However, Praxedes lacks the capital needed for the business. She is asking for a loan of 8,000 PHP to buy items like snack foods, canned goods, sodas, etc. to sell. With these items, she will be able to attract and cater for more customers thus giving her more chance of increasing her sales and profit.

Praxedes dreams of expanding her business in the future so that she will become financially able to send her children to school for better learning and education.

loans.use: to buy items like snack foods, canned goods, sodas, etc. to sell

loans.name: Estrella

texts.en:
Estrella, aged 46, is from the community of Bil-isan, Panglao, Bohol. She is married with three children aged 12, 15 and 17. Her husband works as a construction worker. Estrella has been helping for a long time by raising pigs. She is happy that she can support her husband in meeting their family's needs.

Estrella is asking for a loan to buy pig feed, rice and a weighing scale.  In the future, she hopes that she can have a bigger barn and raise a sow to produce piglets for a better income.

loans.use: to buy pig feed, rice and a weighing scale

loans.name: Cirilo

texts.en:
Cirilo, aged 42, is a married man from the town of Maribojoc, Bohol. He operates a sari-sari store (variety store) business to earn an income. He is asking for a loan to buy merchandise such as toiletries, seasoning, canned goods, soft drinks and snack food. 

Cirilo knows the importance of looking after the well-being of his spouse as they get older. The loan will be helpful so he can replenish his stocks on time and attract more customers. His income will be for his family's daily consumption. He hopes to have a bigger store someday.

loans.use: to buy merchandise such as toiletries, seasoning, canned goods, soft drinks and snack food to sell

loans.name: Rigoberto

texts.en:
Rigoberto is an artisan who specializes in Oaxacan black pottery. He would like to invest in the purchase of different colored clays, including red, white and natural. Rigoberto has been selling through NOVICA since 2008. This is his story:

"I've been in contact with handcrafts from a very young age, and I've held different responsibilities that come with helping in the family workshop.  Thanks to my parents' help, their experience and my personal curiosity, I am knowledgeable about the different techniques and processes required to make Jalisco's black ceramic arts. I want to offer innovative products that are attractive and suited to today's lifestyles. I am certain that arts and crafts are the most important sources of work and tradition in my village, in the state of Jalisco."

"I truly appreciate your support through this microcredit. It is really an excellent opportunity for us to continue crafting our products."

Use the link below to view Rigoberto's ceramics on the NOVICA site:
http://www.novica.com/artistdetail/index.cfm?faid=6948

loans.use: to invest in the purchase of different colored clays, including red, white and natural

loans.name: Ballay

texts.en:
Ballay, aged 42, is married and has three children aged 20, 19 and 16. In 1993, Ballay established her foodstuff business (selling rice, oil, flour and sugar). She began her business because she wanted to raise income to support her family. Working seven days a week and nine hours a day, she earns about Le 500,000 every month. 

Ballay would like a loan of Le 3,000,000 to meet the needs of her customers as the month of Ramadan approaches. In the future, she plans to give her children a quality education and to become a supplier of rice and vegetable oil. Ballay thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more items like rice, oil, flour and sugar to sell

loans.name: Vicky

texts.en:
Vicky, aged 21, is single with one child and lives in the Philippines. She is a farmer and has been managing banana and coconut production to earn a living for a year. Every month, Vicky earns 2,800 PHP from this work. 

She has requested a loan of 3,000 PHP to pay for the labor costs of farm maintenance. Vicky has been a member of GDMPC since 2011. In the future, she hopes to support her child's studies through to their completion.

loans.use: to pay for the labor costs of farm maintenance

loans.name: Nestor

texts.en:
Nestor, aged 36, is married with two children and lives at Mitugas, Tudela. He has been operating a business which involves raising crops, and planting and harvesting bananas and coconuts for sale in the local community to earn a living for the past 12 years. Each month, he earns 7,900 PHP from this type of business. 

Nestor has requested a loan of 10,000 PHP to purchase fertilizers. This year, he joined GDMPC. In the future, Nestor wants to save a reserve for future emergencies and to purchase more farmland.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers

loans.name: Felix

texts.en:
Felix is 56 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is widowed with one child. 

Felix has a food/retail shop or sari-sari store that buys and sells canned goods, snacks, personal care products, home use products and beverages. He has had this business for five years. He requested a loan for 5,000 PHP to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages. 

Felix has been a member of HSPFI since 2009. In the future, he hopes to improve his business for the education of his child.

loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages

loans.name: Tomas

texts.en:
Tomas lives in Mitugas, Tudela, Misamis Occidental. He has earned income from his plantation for the past 20 years in order to support the needs of his four children. Tomas earns an income of 4,000 PHP a month from this business. For a 40-year-old father, there’s nothing that can make him happier than to see his children successful in their studies. 

Without hesitation, Tomas is borrowing 5,000 PHP from GDMPC microcredit to purchase seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. He is new to GDMPC. In the future, Tomas plans to hopefully improve his business.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise

loans.name: Joneto

texts.en:
Joneto, aged 30, is a married entrepreneur with one child from Mitugas, Tudela. He earns his income from his banana plantation. The business started almost five years ago and he earns 6,000 PHP a month. 

To improve his business, Joneto is borrowing 10,000 PHP from GDMPC microcredit which he recently joined to purchase seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. Before long, he’s hopeful of the possibility of expanding his business.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise

loans.name: Miguel Jr.

texts.en:
Miguel Jr., aged 43, is married with four children. He is from Dalingap, Tudela, where his banana and root crops production is located. Miguel Jr. was only 33 years old when he started cultivating this land. That is quite a long time but he never ceases because his passion for farming urges him to go on working. Each month, Miguel Jr. earns 4,000 PHP, which he uses for his family. 

Miguel Jr. has just joined GDMPC. He is borrowing 5,000 PHP to purchase seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. Miguel Jr. plans to apply appropriate fertilizers and to expand his business range.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise

loans.name: Pen

texts.en:
Rice farming is the primary source of income for the people who live in the Baray district. Pen and her husband live there happily with their four children; however, recently one of her children married and now lives far away. Pen has been planting and harvesting rice and vegetables to sell to local traders each cropping season. She is satisfied with the support from her husband and children in managing this business. She has been in the farming business for almost 12 years.

To maintain good production and an abundant harvest in the coming season, Pen would like to take out a loan of 600,000 KHR to purchase fertilizers and pay for plowing fees. She believes that she will be able to elevate her family’s living conditions someday through her determination and commitment.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and pay for plowing fees

loans.name: Emprendiendo Hacia El Exito Group

texts.es: Hola a todos desde Perú, el grupo “Emprendiendo hacia el éxito” es un grupo caracterizado por su dedicación, esfuerzo y mucho sacrificio para lograr sus metas. La Sra. Celia es una de las 7 socias; tiene 30 años de edad, es casada y madre de 02 niños que son el motor y motivo de su lucha diaria. Ella tiene una botica de salud en la cual vende medicamentos y también productos para bebes. El préstamo lo utilizará para la compra de diversas medicinas y pañales para recién nacidos que es un producto muy demandado; pero que no tiene en stock. Ella sabe que será difícil, pero sueña con hacer crecer su negocio y mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia. Al igual que todos los miembros del grupo, la Sra. Celia se encuentra muy agradecida con todas las personas que la ayudan a lograr sus sueños.
texts.en:
Hello to everyone from Peru.  The communal bank "Emprendiendo hacia el éxito" is characterized by its dedication, effort and strong sacrifice in meeting its goals.  Mrs. Celia is one of the seven members.  She is 30, married and has two children who are the drive and motivation behind her daily struggle.  She runs a health store where she sells medicine and baby products.

The loan will be used to buy an assortment of medicines and diapers for newborns, a very popular product that she does not carry in stock.  She knows it will be difficult but she dreams of expanding her business and improving her family's quality of life.  Like all the members of her group, Celia is very grateful to all the people who help them meet their goals.

loans.use: To buy assorted medicines and diapers for newborns.

loans.name: Joyrin

texts.en:
Joyrin, aged 23, is a married entrepreneur with one child from Mitugas, Tudela, who earns his income from his motorcycle transport business. He started his business four years ago and he earns 6,000 PHP a month. 

To improve his business, Joyrin is borrowing 10,000 PHP from GDMPC microcredit, which he recently joined, to buy accessories and tires. Before long, he’s hopeful of the possibility of expanding his business.

loans.use: to buy accessories and tires

loans.name: Romeo

texts.en: Romeo, aged 23, is married with one child and lives in the Philippines. He manages a gardening business to earn a living. Romeo has been doing this for five years and every month he earns 5,000 PHP from this work. He has requested a loan of 10,000 PHP to purchase fertilizer. Romeo is new to GDMPC. In the future, Romeo hopes to support his child's studies through to their completion.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer.

loans.name: Gello

texts.en: Gello, aged 34, is separated with two children and lives in the Philippines. He operates a gardening business to earn a living. Gello has been doing this for 20 years and every month he earns 6,000 PHP from this work. He has requested a loan of 10,000 PHP to purchase fertilizer. Gello is new to GDMPC. He hopes to expand his business one day.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer.

loans.name: Crema

texts.en: Crema is a hard-working entrepreneur who has a shell crafting business in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 29,500 through NWTF to buy more seashells for her business. NWTF is listing Crema's business profile again to support her in her efforts to secure her family's future.

loans.use: to buy more seashells for her shell crafting business.

loans.name: Dam

texts.en:
Dam is from the Baray district in Kompong Tom province. He is 44 years old, married, and has four children, three of whom attend school and need daily support. 

Dam earns a living by fishing and providing construction services to people around the province. He is expert in constructing wooden houses rather than brick houses. However, he has self-confidence in building both wooden houses and brick houses. Dam has learned to gradually improve his skills and his business while he is operating it. He has been in the two businesses for the past 11 years. Dam’s wife serves as his motivation in helping him to earn household income. She usually goes fishing with him and is also involved in a farming business.

Due to the age of his house, it is in disrepair and suffers from the weather factor each year. Dam would like to repair it by himself with a few members of his team, yet he doesn’t have enough capital to purchase construction supplies. That is why he is asking for a loan of 1,500 USD to purchase wallboard, floorboards, and tiles for re-covering his roof. With the help of this loan, Dam hopes to have a suitable house in which to live and to provide his family with better living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase wallboard, floorboards, and tiles for re-covering his roof.

loans.name: Flora

texts.en:
Flora, aged 53, is a married woman with two children who lives in Macabayao, Jimenez. She owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of different products to earn a living and has been in this business for 30 years. Each month, she earns 3,000 PHP. 

Flora has requested a loan of 2,000 PHP to purchase products like canned goods, noodles, sugar and coffee. Recently, she joined GDMPC. In the future, Flora wants to build a house and to support the completion of her children's study.

loans.use: to purchase products like canned goods, noodles, sugar and coffee to sell

loans.name: Bat-Erdene

texts.en:
Bat-Erdene, aged 25, lives with his wife and son in a Mongolian yurt in Uvs province, Mongolia. His wife's name is Oyuntsetseg and she is 25 years old. His son, Temuulen, attends kindergarten and is two years old. Bat-erdene started a taxi service business in 2012. His business' net profit is 250,000 - 300,000 MNT every month. 

His wife is planning to start a perfume retail business from a rental counter. She needs 2,500,000 MNT to purchase the necessary products to start her new business. However, they only have 1,500,000 MNT. Bat-Erdene is hard-working and an open-minded person. He is requesting a 2,500,000 MNT loan in order to start his wife's new business.

loans.use: To purchase the necessary products to start his wife's new business

loans.name: Nomer

texts.en: Nomer, aged 44, is married and lives in Mitugas, Tudela, Misamis Occidental. He owns and operates a plot of farmland, planting bananas to earn a living. Nomer has been in this business for 25 years and earns 7,000 PHP each month. He has requested a loan of 10,000 PHP to purchase farm chemicals. Nomer is a new member of Kiva's partner, GDMPC. In the future, his plan is to save his returns in order to buy another plot of farmland.

loans.use: to purchase farm chemicals

loans.name: Otgontuya

texts.en:
Otgontuya is 33 years old and lives with her husband, named D. Huderchuluun, and two children in a ger in Uvs province, Mongolia. Her daughter and son attend the secondary school. Otgontuya graduated from a vocational school as a shoemaker in 2007 and started to work in a small shoe factory. In summer, she makes and sells coverings for the ger (Mongolian yurt) in which most Mongolians live.  Her current assets are 1,200,000 MNT.  

Since 2010, Otgontuya has started operating a shoe factory in her own home. Her business seems to be sustainable because she has gained a number of regular customers. She is a good-natured and hard-working person who says, "I want my children to have a good education". She needs a loan of 1,500,000 MNT to purchase raw materials for shoes.

loans.use: To purchase raw materials for shoes

loans.name: Nancy Marisol

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Progreso Del Mar se reúne cada 15 días en el hermoso balneario de San Mateo en la ciudad de  Manta, conocido por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año por turistas nacionales y extranjeros, en  este lugar la mayoría de los habitantes se dedica a la pesca y a las faenas del mar.

En este lugar vive la señora Nancy, tiene 43 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen dos hijos los mismos que ya son mayores de edad, pero aun viven con ella a pesar de que uno de ellos está casado y vive con su esposa. Su esposo se dedica a la pesca. 

Ella para ganarse algo por su cuenta se dedica a la venta de productos por catálogos de Avon y Esika (artículos de belleza, cosméticos perfumería y accesorios para damas) y también vende ropa, trabaja todos los días más que todo en las horas de la mañana, su forma de venta es puerta a puerta y bajo pedidos, deja a crédito y cobra semanalmente, ya son 13 años que viene dedicada a este tipo de ventas y le ha ido muy bien ya que tiene bastante clientela. 

Ella está repitiendo el crédito ya que le fue muy bien en su negocio, sobretodo en los días del padre y la madre, con sus ganancias arreglo su cocina ya que puso cerámica en su mesón y así mejoro un poco su casa. Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar ropa, perfumes, bisutería, cosméticos y cremas. Está en el Banco Comunal desde hace 13 años  y le gusta por la ayuda que le dan con los créditos.
 
Su sueño es seguir aumentado su negocio.
texts.en:
The communal bank Progreso del Mar meets every 15 days in the beautiful spa resort of San Mateo in the city of Manta, known for its beautiful beaches which are visited frequently throughout the year by national and foreign tourists.  Here most of the inhabitants work in fishing and marine work.

This is where we meet Nancy, 43, who is married and has two adult children who still live at home, although one is married and lives with his wife.  Her husband is a fisherman.

She earns a living selling products by catalogue such as Avon and Esika (beauty products, cosmetics, perfume and women's accessories), and also sells clothing.  She works every day, especially in the mornings, going door to door on an order basis.  She delivers goods on credit and collects payment weekly.  For 13 years she has been in this type of sales business and it has gone well for her because she has many customers.

She is taking out another loan because the previous one gave her business a big boost, especially on Mother's and Father's days.  With the profit she earned she was able to fix up her kitchen with ceramic tile, making her home nicer.  This loan will be used to buy clothing, perfumes, jewelry, cosmetics and creams.  She has been in the communal bank for 13 years and enjoys it because of the help she gets with the loans.

Her goal is to increase her business.

loans.use: to buy clothes, perfumes, jewelry, cosmetics and creams.

loans.name: Las Nuevas Amigas Group

texts.es:
¡Saludos desde Perú! Les presento el Grupo Las Nuevas Amigas

Este grupo está emprendiendo su segundo ciclo, lo conforman 07 socias que son amigas entre sí, una de ellas es la Sra. Isabel que es la presidenta del grupo. Ella tiene 53 años de sus 07 hijos solo 1 vive con ella, los mayores son independientes. Isabel  tiene una tienda de abarrotes, al que le puso por nombre “ABARROTES SHIRLEY” que es el nombre de una de sus hijas, en su negocio vende toda clase de productos de primera necesidad; sus clientes son básicamente sus vecinos y personas del lugar donde vive, quienes acuden a su negocio diariamente a comprarle diversos productos,este negocio lo empezó con mucho sacrificio con el propósito de darle a sus hijos una buena educación, esta agradecida  a todos los inversionistas que hacen posible sus créditos porque le permitirán comprar mas productos alimenticios para surtir su tienda, de esta manera tendrá contentos a sus clientes.

Isabel viste casaca ploma.
texts.en:
Greetings from Peru!  Let me introduce you the communal bank "Las Nuevas Amigas".

This group is beginning its second cycle and is comprised of seven members who are friends.  One of them is Isabel, who is the president of the group.  She is 53 and has seven children, of whom only one lives with her.  The older ones are all independent.  Isabel has a grocery store that she named  "ABARROTES SHIRLEY", after one of her daughters.  

She sells all kinds of essential items and her customers are mainly neighbors and people who live nearby and go to her store daily to buy different products.  She started her business with much sacrifice in order to give her children a good education.  She is grateful to all the lenders who have made the loans possible because this will allow her to buy more food products to stock her store and keep her customers happy.

Isabel is wearing a grey jacket.

loans.use: To buy food products.

loans.name: Lucio

texts.es:
Lucio tiene 45 años, está casado con Justina, con quien tiene tres hijos.
Su principal actividad es la agricultura. De todos los productos que siembra, el principal es el maíz, lo siembra en grandes hectáreas de terrenos propios y otros arrendados, pues cuando no le alcanza terreno tiene que alquilar más. Ahora se encuentra en la cosecha de maíz, espera obtener buenas ganancias. “Invierto poco y obtengo muchas ganancias con el maíz”, afirma. Es por esta razón que dentro de poco espera comprar más terrenos agrícolas y abastecer la demanda, también siembra papa, alverja y otros.

Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Productores Huallhua” y este es su crédito número 8 con MFP. En todo este tiempo aprovechó el dinero en mejorar su negocio, pues pudo aumentar su capital y obtener más ganancias. Por ello promete ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas, además le gusta trabajar con su grupo, porque se ayudan entre sí.
Lucio invertirá este dinero en la compra de 60 sacos de fertilizantes naturales para esparcir en sus cultivos de maíz.
texts.en:
Lucio, 45, is married to Justina and they have three children.

He works mainly in agriculture.  Of all the crops he grows, corn is the main one and he grows it on large patches of his own land as well as on rented land when he needs more cropland.  Now he is harvesting corn and hopes to bring in a good profit.  "I invest little and obtain a good profit from corn", he says.  this is why he hopes to buy more farmland soon and supply the demand.
